commit_message:
Fix systemd service mongodb on xenial element

We have several issues on mongodb element for xenial.

This change propose these actions:
  - fix a typo on check-numa script.
  - fix variable issue on the systemd parameter ExecStart.
  - create a dependency and an order between numa-check and mongo service.

Closes-bug: #1743612
Change-Id: I50123dad58b9a368f528d086fa28f6abc86464a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 20:45:12.000000000', 'message': "WIP NEEDS TEST Fix container listing while in sharding state

Listing a container while it is partially sharding requires
the final part of the listing to be supplied by the sharding
container. This was apparently broken because that final
partial listing request sent '&end_marker=None' (yes, the
string None).

Change-Id: I1fcce2f331aaf3d0264c7be3744483dc33aea7f9
"}, {'created': '2018-01-10 17:34:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix container listing while in sharding state

Change-Id: I1fcce2f331aaf3d0264c7be3744483dc33aea7f9
"}, {'created': '2018-01-15 10:03:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix container listing while in sharding state

Listing a container while it is partially sharding requires
the final part of the listing to be supplied by the sharding
container. This was apparently broken because that final

Change-Id: I1fcce2f331aaf3d0264c7be3744483dc33aea7f9

commit_message:
Fix container listing while in sharding state

Listing a container while it is partially sharding requires
the final part of the listing to be supplied by the sharding
container. This was apparently broken because that final
partial listing request sent '&end_marker=None' (yes, the
string None).

Change-Id: I1fcce2f331aaf3d0264c7be3744483dc33aea7f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-15 12:41:11.000000000', 'message': 'RBAC authorization support

Kubernetes 1.6.x supports new authorization mode - RBAC. To support it
in OpenStack-Helm we need to make sure that entrypoint init container is
authorizing with role that allows to query k8s API to get endpoints,
pods, services, jobs and daemonsets. This commit implements it adding
role creation to bootstrap chart and manually attaching volume with the
new role token to init containers.

To make sure that kubernetes_entrypoint_init_container template
generates mounts correctly, it was needed to change it's third argument
from "[]" string to list object - that's why so many files are changed
here.

Implements: blueprint rbac-support
Change-Id: Ib51a9bd67fcdfc5601eca1c941022981c2b66384

Kubernetes 1.6.x supports new authorization mode - RBAC. To support it
in OpenStack-Helm we need to make sure that entrypoint init container is
authorizing with role that allows to query k8s API to get endpoints,
pods, services, jobs and daemonsets. This commit implements it adding
role creation to bootstrap chart and manually attaching volume with the
new role token to init containers.

To make sure that kubernetes_entrypoint_init_container template
generates mounts correctly, it was needed to change it's third argument
from list string to list object - that's why so many files are changed
here.

As bootstrap job becomes a hard dependency here, we need to add it to
basic.sh script.

Three of the services (Keystone, Ceph and Ingress) queried Kubernetes API
independently and thus they required additional Service Accounts, Rules,
Secrets and Roles Bindings.

Implements: blueprint rbac-support
Change-Id: Ib51a9bd67fcdfc5601eca1c941022981c2b66384
Co-Authored-By: Mateusz Blaszkowski <mateusz.blaszkowski@intel.com>

"}, {'created': '2017-09-28 08:48:48.000000000', 'message': "RBAC authorization support

Kubernetes 1.6.x supports new authorization mode - RBAC. To support it
in OpenStack-Helm we need to make sure that entrypoint init container is
authorizing with role that allows to query k8s API to get endpoints,
pods, services, jobs and daemonsets. This commit implements it by adding
ClusterRole, ClusterRoleBinding, ServiceAccount and Secret for each
of the service that uses k8s-entrypoint. The secret is then mounted to
k8s-entrypoint init container so that it can query Kubernetes API.

Please note that creating ClusterRole, ClusterRoleBinding, ServiceAccount
and Secret for each service is necessary in order to support having
each of the service in different namespace (which is the end goal, but
even now, Ceph is created in a separate namespace than rest of the
services). If only one Secret was created, it could be only attached to
the service which is in the same namespace as Secret's namespace. This
also enforces to use one ServiceAccount per service as Secret is always
connected to the ServiceAccount (they must be in the same namespae).
When it comes to ClusterRole - this resource is not namespaced so it may
have been created only once, but in such case we would need to add
additional chart that would need to be installed before any any other
chart what would increase complexity of installation.

Three of the services (Keystone, Ceph and Ingress) queried Kubernetes API
independently and thus they required additional Service Accounts, Rules,
Secrets and Roles Bindings.

Implements: blueprint rbac-support
Change-Id: Ib51a9bd67fcdfc5601eca1c941022981c2b66384
Co-Authored-By: Mateusz Blaszkowski <mateusz.blaszkowski@intel.com>

"}, {'created': '2017-11-02 09:05:17.000000000', 'message': "RBAC authorization support

Kubernetes 1.6.x supports new authorization mode - RBAC. To support it
in OpenStack-Helm we need to make sure that entrypoint init container is
authorizing with role that allows to query k8s API to get endpoints,
pods, services, jobs and daemonsets. This commit implements it by adding
ClusterRole, ClusterRoleBinding, ServiceAccount and Secret for each
of the service that uses k8s-entrypoint. The secret is then mounted to
k8s-entrypoint init container so that it can query Kubernetes API.

Please note that creating ClusterRole, ClusterRoleBinding, ServiceAccount
and Secret for each service is necessary in order to support having
each of the service in different namespace (which is the end goal, but
even now, Ceph is created in a separate namespace than rest of the
services). If only one Secret was created, it could be only attached to
the service which is in the same namespace as Secret's namespace. This
also enforces to use one ServiceAccount per service as Secret is always
connected to the ServiceAccount (they must be in the same namespae).
When it comes to ClusterRole - this resource is not namespaced so it may
have been created only once, but in such case we would need to add
additional chart that would need to be installed before any any other
chart what would increase complexity of installation.

Services: Keystone, Ceph, Glance and Ingress query Kubernetes API
independently and thus they required additional Service Accounts, Rules,
Secrets and Roles Bindings.

Implements: blueprint rbac-support
Change-Id: Ib51a9bd67fcdfc5601eca1c941022981c2b66384
Co-Authored-By: Mateusz Blaszkowski <mateusz.blaszkowski@intel.com>
"}, {'created': '2017-11-03 15:16:11.000000000', 'message': "RBAC authorization support

commit_message:
RBAC authorization support

Kubernetes 1.6.x supports new authorization mode - RBAC. To support it
in OpenStack-Helm we need to make sure that entrypoint init container is
authorizing with role that allows to query k8s API to get endpoints,
pods, services, jobs and daemonsets. This commit implements it by adding
ClusterRole, ClusterRoleBinding, ServiceAccount and Secret for each
of the service that uses k8s-entrypoint. The secret is then mounted to
k8s-entrypoint init container so that it can query Kubernetes API.

Please note that creating ClusterRole, ClusterRoleBinding, ServiceAccount
and Secret for each service is necessary in order to support having
each of the service in different namespace (which is the end goal, but
even now, Ceph is created in a separate namespace than rest of the
services). If only one Secret was created, it could be only attached to
the service which is in the same namespace as Secret's namespace. This
also enforces to use one ServiceAccount per service as Secret is always
connected to the ServiceAccount (they must be in the same namespae).
When it comes to ClusterRole - this resource is not namespaced so it may
have been created only once, but in such case we would need to add
additional chart that would need to be installed before any any other
chart what would increase complexity of installation.

Services: Keystone, Ceph, Glance, Gnocchi and Ingress query Kubernetes API
independently and thus they required additional Service Accounts, Roles,
Secrets and Roles Bindings.

Implements: blueprint rbac-support
Change-Id: Ib51a9bd67fcdfc5601eca1c941022981c2b66384
Co-Authored-By: Mateusz Blaszkowski <mateusz.blaszkowski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Artur Korzeniewski <artur.korzeniewski@intel.com>

commit_message:
Get rid of code patching in containers

When generating CNI container our scripts were applying two patches to
the Kuryr codebase. One was making sure k8s_client will correctly split
WATCH responses with b"\n" and second was patching cni.main to enable
daemonized mode for os_vif's privsep instead of sudo/rootwrap mode.

This was critically unmaintainable, as any changes to patched files might
make the patches unapplyable and break the container building scripts.

This commit resolves the problem by completely removing step of applying
patches:
* k8s_client patch is applied directly into the codbase as it's a no-op
  in Python 2.7 and in Python 3.5 should be a correct way of doing
  things.
* cni.main patch gets removed completely, as CNI container is run with
  sudo privileges, so privsep in rootwrap/sudo mode will work fine (and
  maybe even better as it gets rid of "broken pipe" errors in kubelet
  logs).

Change-Id: I4171e3807dece12e41e04abefa1d16eb675f7d06

commit_message:
kibana: allow use of server.basePath

When using server.basePath a dynamic bundle optimization will be started.
This job needs write access to /usr/share/kibana/optimize/bundles.

Change-Id: Ieaae79a5940f3972a8067814a1113ef635970875

commit_message:
os-vif: queens release 1.9.0

- This is change reverts a change to the
  os-vif subnet object which broke kuryr-kubernetes.
  Ie1b65fb29b6abcf77a531404e67c7e60b2183c19
- This change also disables the pyroute2
  driver due to a file handle leak in pyroute2,
  and introduces an iptools driver as a workaround for queens.
  The iptools driver will be removed in rocky once a suitable
  release of pyroute2 is available.
  Idbb3c6b09ff8a883863925cd0db9b552b726a54d

Change-Id: I1d0b52bb8893e6b892af579c0a5d3216859f1e5b

commit_message:
Initialize BadRequest exception with correct message.

Currently some BadRequest exceptions are raised with a wrong
argument 'msg', this leads to totally helpless informations
returned by the API when errors occurr. This patch fixes
the problem.

Change-Id: Ifd821e8297a44fd0b25f879f79fe6a2456c1d8a5
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Supplementing accelerator CRUD api

with this patch, we are able to do CRUD via accelerator api

POST /accelerators
    Create a new accelerator
GET /accelerators/{uuid}
    Retrieve information about the given accelerator
GET /accelerators
    Retrieve a list of accelerators
PATCH /accelerators/{uuid}
    Update information about the given accelerator
DELETE /accelerators/{uuid}
    Delete the given accelerator

Change-Id: Ibc97ec49f557cac69dfd38f99f28bc7b205732b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 13:56:29.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I37fdd240862d4369160c3e7a7e5a004a154a5944
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I37fdd240862d4369160c3e7a7e5a004a154a5944

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: I653f7b73ded5a2648c2d519136e261d0ea81c1c1
(cherry picked from commit b057efe2c55633e487db16802ffedf66d5d351f9)

commit_message:
support adding and deleting templates without the need to restart vitrage.

* templates are now stored in the database.
* evaluator is reloaded whenever a template is added/removed.
* supporting all types of templates (standard, equivalence, definition)
* new cli commands:
  - vitrage template add
  - vitrage template delete

Change-Id: I58abf5e034662206bd6919493c95c450c0ecdf9c
Depends-On: I07741ed100b9eb70b303567706b659d10a34b156
Depends-On: I283f6ca968a6289db6d218d37fb6e5b197130d46
Implements: blueprint crud-templates

TEST FIX

Change-Id: I9be4603ef23a4766ecf81331f8992568f6a7ade7

subject: Neutron-server start error when not use ovn l3
messages:
[{'account_id': 21550, 'date': '2017-12-27 03:23:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21550, 'date': '2017-12-27 03:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23458, 'date': '2017-12-28 13:58:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm not against this patch. I just thought it is time to remove the ovn_l3_mode option. It is not a functional option, just for special judgments and has been deprecated for a stable version.
We can use isinstance(plugin, OVNL3RouterPlugin) or hasattr(plugin, some attr) to instead.
Which one to choose depends on whether l3_ovn.py will have circular import.
Guys, any thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-12-29 06:04:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I'm not against this patch. I just thought it is time to remove the
 > ovn_l3_mode option. It is not a functional option, just for special
 > judgments and has been deprecated for a stable version.
 > We can use isinstance(plugin, OVNL3RouterPlugin) or hasattr(plugin,
 > some attr) to instead.
 > Which one to choose depends on whether l3_ovn.py will have circular
 > import.
 > Guys, any thoughts?

Actuvally I am thinking the same too. I think we can remove the ovn_l3_mode option given that deprecated_for_removal is True in Pike.

@xurong00037997 - Do you have use case to not to use native OVN l3 ?
If native OVN l3 is not used, then neutron l3 agent is used ?

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-12-29 09:37:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

subject: Replace double spaces with single space
messages:
[{'account_id': 16710, 'date': '2018-01-15 23:05:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16710, 'date': '2018-01-15 23:08:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I only hit the .py files. I could also hit the rest of the files (if you guys even think this is necessary). I'm just trying to knock of some etherpad todos and felt like messing around with some bash."}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-01-16 13:27:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

We didn't have to do this... But it's done, so sure.

@efried don't feel like you need to review this line by line. I already did that, and this doesn't need 2 reviewers spending that time. A thumbs up on the concept should be sufficient and then one of us can +W."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-01-16 15:18:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The reasons for single-space-after-period don't apply to fixed width fonts.

IMO, any benefit gained by "consistency" is overshadowed by having muddied up the git blame, making it that much harder for a maintainer to track down the context/reasoning behind a given comment or docstring.

So it wouldn't offend me if we abandoned this patch.  But I won't block it either.  Passive-aggressive +0.'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-01-16 22:48:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm really fine either way... Abandoning may be the best course if efried isn't on board."}, {'account_id': 16710, 'date': '2018-01-17 15:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Replace double spaces with single space

This removes all instances of double spaces after a period with a
single space in all .py files. This has been an area of contention
for certain reviewers and this change provides consistency throughout
the code.

Change-Id: I9d321e561691e48a35126059430fb5bd1a07fbdd

commit_message:
Monasca: Grafana 4 and improved Libvirt monitoring

This commit adds various patches to monasca-ui and
monasca-agent that improve Libvirt monitoring and allow for
visualizing metrics with (unpatched) Grafana 4.

Similar to its companion change in stable/ocata
(I11ff71fa45f4ec0c608118ad2370175aa24084ba), these patches did
not make it into stable/pike upstream due to stable/pike being
to old.

Change-Id: I2e8478fc8c59ad01f2563fbaff2646c66875011f

commit_message:
Add pcre-lib for uwsgi

Building the wheel with PCRE support may improve
performance, but at the very least gets rid of
a nasty log message. We prefer our logs not to
have nasty messages in them, so we add the extra
package.

Change-Id: Ibab309445f9398b6f48dc9ea12d89056d14b7a71
Closes-Bug: #1742538

commit_message:
Add ability to manage non-inventory hosts

We may want to load balance to existing services that we aren't managing
via ansible. Currently the hosts have to exist in the inventory in order
to add a VIP for these hosts, this patch adds the ability to set the
hostnames and addresses of the hosts manually when they aren't in the
ansible inventory.

Additionally, this patch adds a test for both the group method and the
host_lists method.

Change-Id: Ida66f401d8320d9bf14eac9b8014124631978808
(cherry picked from commit d2b2492c16711dbf1971ef513bcd43d33339cf38)

commit_message:
k8s_fedora: Update coredns config to pass e2e

To pass the e2e conformance tests, coredns needs to
be configured with POD-MODE verified. Otherwise, pods
won't be resolvable [1].

[1] https://github.com/coredns/coredns/tree/master/plugin/kubernetes

Change-Id: I23d183f6a6d6b92fcfac95ac3fb27945c1b0efb8
Closes-Bug: #1738633

commit_message:
k8s_fedora: Add RBAC configuration

* Make certificates and kubeconfigs compatible
  with NodeAuthorizer [1].
* Add CoreDNS roles and rolebindings.
* Create the system:kube-apiserver-to-kubelet ClusterRole.
* Bind the system:kube-apiserver-to-kubelet ClusterRole to
  the kubernetes user.
* remove creation of kube-system namespaces, it is created
  by default
* do not enable kubelet and kube-proxy services on master
  (done here, because after enabling rbac is becoming a
   real issue since before kubelet was starting but it
   cound not register with the apiserver)

[1] https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/authorization/node/

Depends-On: If43c3d0a0d83c42ff1fceffe4bcc333b31dbdaab
Change-Id: Idb782b910ec09f5138a96eb5664e954592280e21

commit_message:
k8s: Set require-kubeconfig when needed

From kubernetes 1.8 [1] --require-kubeconfig is deprecated and
in kubernetes 1.9 it is removed.

Add --require-kubeconfig only for k8s <= 1.8.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/36745

Closes-Bug: #1718926

Change-Id: I0db6438598e0ca2370e2a48cf0b1460c9fb5940d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 13:30:03.000000000', 'message': 'archive_deleted_instances is not atomic for insert/delete

Archive deleted instances first moves deleted rows to the shadow
tables and then deletes the rows from the original tables.
However, because it does 2 different selects (to get the rows to
insert and to delete) we can have the case that a row is not inserted
in the shadow table but removed from the original. This can happen
when there are new deleted rows between the insert and delete.

This patch fixes this by explicitly deleting only those IDs that were
inserted.

Change-Id: I4f2e1632aac96afa7ce06908dc30c0716bcb87b2
Closes-Bug: #1727266
'}, {'created': '2017-12-06 14:32:21.000000000', 'message': 'archive_deleted_instances is not atomic for insert/delete

tables and then deletes the rows from the original tables.
However, because it does 2 different selects (to get the rows to
insert and to delete) we can have the case that a row is not inserted
in the shadow table but removed from the original. This can happen
when there are new deleted rows between the insert and delete.

This patch fixes this by explicitly deleting only those IDs that were
inserted.

Change-Id: I4f2e1632aac96afa7ce06908dc30c0716bcb87b2
Closes-Bug: #1727266
'}]
commit_message:
archive_deleted_instances is not atomic for insert/delete

Archive deleted instances first moves deleted rows to the shadow
tables and then deletes the rows from the original tables.
However, because it does 2 different selects (to get the rows to
insert and to delete) we can have the case that a row is not inserted
in the shadow table but removed from the original. This can happen
when there are new deleted rows between the insert and delete.

This patch fixes this by explicitly deleting only those IDs that were
inserted.

Change-Id: I4f2e1632aac96afa7ce06908dc30c0716bcb87b2
Closes-Bug: #1727266

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11105, 'date': '2017-11-14 03:47:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13404, 'date': '2017-11-15 10:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2017-11-15 14:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2017-12-11 06:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2017-12-11 23:05:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

The import renaming that happened is unrelated and potentially problematic.  Can we either undo that or at least pick a better new name?'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2017-12-20 07:37:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2017-12-20 07:55:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Just curious, why can't we go to flake8 3.5.0? I see that is the latest version. I didn't investigate it myself to figure it out.

https://pypi.python.org/pypi/flake8

Might be good to document the reason for 2.6.x vs 3.5.0."}, {'account_id': 13404, 'date': '2017-12-20 09:26:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2017-12-20 14:19:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I believe the reason for only going to 2.7.0 is that this is in service of the requirements change to use pycodestyle instead of pep8.  I'm okay with making the minimum bump required to do that.  New versions (especially a major bump) of the style checker libs tend to cause issues.

A note in the commit message would be good, but I won't block it on that basis."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2017-12-21 08:07:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I originally tried to go to the latest version, but it was requiring several larger changes to hacking, so I went for the quick and easy solution first so that we can move to pycodestyle at least in order to deprecate pep8. 

I was originally assuming this change would be landing in less than 2 months so that we can spend the 2 months on doing the flake 3.x update (which is fairly labor intensive).

I'll post a followup once this change has landed."}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2017-12-21 08:12:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2017-12-21 08:39:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2017-12-25 06:45:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11105, 'date': '2017-12-28 04:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2017-12-29 07:08:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-12 16:43:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-01-15 21:27:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

how many reviews does it take before someone can do W+1 ? it received two +2 already (although over two minimally different patch set revisions)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-01-15 21:55:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> how many reviews does it take before someone can do W+1 ? it
 > received two +2 already (although over two minimally different
 > patch set revisions)

Oh, good point.  I forgot that Joe had already +2'd it.  The only problem at this point is that we're very close to Oslo library freeze, which means we could land this but probably wouldn't want to release it yet this cycle.  Is that going to be a problem for the pycodestyle conversion work?"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-01-17 07:10:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

hacking isn't automatically bumped so releasing it with this change should have zero effect. I think it would still make sense to merge it even if you decide to not release hacking in time anymore. It's time to move to newer dependencies for a number of reasons. I think the 2.6.x update is a minimal step compared to the flake3 step that is coming afterwards. lets target that larger for the next cycle."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-01-17 14:38:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

Okay, sounds good.'}]

commit_message:
Transition to flake8 2.6.x

flake8 2.6.x performed the conversion to pycodestyle (which is
the new name of pep8). Remove the explicit dependencies of
hacking as flake8 is going to pull in mccabe, pyflakes and
pycodestyle in the versions that are needed.

Change-Id: I12b5e114c5c6783e9da5cca2818ac9266a00fc87

commit_message:
Fix default role missing pip packages

The default role is missing keystoneauth1 and oslo.utils pip
packages. Both of them are needed by monasca-agent venv to work
and build properly.

Change-Id: I10f61ac70effdcb8758fd44c92d6248af6b4ce2d
Closes-Bug: #1736036
(cherry picked from commit a758a204cc07ff34426d8afffd020d43176b5736)

[{'account_id': 16310, 'date': '2018-01-17 13:37:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27143, 'date': '2018-01-17 13:42:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This was causing issues on our environment. Thanks, Flavio.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-01-17 13:49:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

For master/queens the pip install is handled without using dependencies any more. All roles now need to assume that pip is already there.'}, {'account_id': 16310, 'date': '2018-01-17 13:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> For master/queens the pip install is handled without using
 > dependencies any more. All roles now need to assume that pip is
 > already there.

Good to know, thanks Jesse.

So, this repo does not have a pike branch. Is it possible to create a pike branch and have this change applied to it?'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-01-17 14:33:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oops - missed that. The pike branch has been created from the appropriate correct time, so the meta entry is still there. This patch can be abandoned.'}, {'account_id': 16310, 'date': '2018-01-17 14:36:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Awesome!

Thanks you Jesse :D'}, {'account_id': 16310, 'date': '2018-01-17 14:37:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Not necessary on master/queens as all roles assumes that that pip is already present.'}]

[{'created': '2018-01-17 13:37:36.000000000', 'message': "Add pip_install as role dependency

pip is required to install 'pip_requires_packages'. This change adds
pip_install role as dependency to the os_monasca-agent role to ensure
that pip is present on the target host(s).

Change-Id: I584f533230c79fb6a5dccde12c76b60b521b9174

commit_message:
Add pip_install as role dependency

pip is required to install 'pip_requires_packages'. This change adds
pip_install role as dependency to the os_monasca-agent role to ensure
that pip is present on the target host(s).

Change-Id: I584f533230c79fb6a5dccde12c76b60b521b9174

(1 comment)

on changing the default, that's why the upgrade tag exists in the changelogs. That's the only way we've been changing defaults in the past."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2017-09-22 13:00:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I think the way to think about changing defaults is the following:

We do not guaruntee that same behavior of all parts of the system between releases. We do state that an old config file will be respected and not break a new set of code. That doesn't mean that default behavior doesn't change, as long as it's not something which 
we know will break existing systems. The default we set here was
because of challenges in the CI system, which we don't seem to 
have any more."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-09-22 13:28:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Change livesnapshot to true by default

Because of past qemu bugs we set this to default off and required a
workaround to enable it. However these issues appear to be fixed, and
we should enable this by default for people (with the ability to turn
it off if it's causing crashes in their environment). Metacloud/Cisco
has been running default this way the entire time without issue.

Change-Id: I4545cc99683d311c41c8d6d8dc9787ea6ec6cbc9

commit_message:
adds iptools driver for ip commands

- This change adds an iptools driver
  based on the process exec.
- This driver is a workaround for a file handle
  leak in the current release of pyroute2.
  https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/pull/443
- This driver is considered deprecated and will
  be removed when a new release of pyroute2 is
  available.

Change-Id: Idbb3c6b09ff8a883863925cd0db9b552b726a54d

Just a question from people, would it be worthwhile to try to make it so that the user just provides the username, password to the root sushy object and then the sushy object tries to initiate a redfish session and then falls back to basic auth? That way any machines that require a redfish session automatically have one. And if it fails to create a redfish session it will fall back to basic auth. That way they do not have to know to create_session() and do not have to explicitly call it.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-06-28 08:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

> Just a question from people, would it be worthwhile to try to make it so that the user just provides the username, password to the root sushy object and then the sushy object tries to initiate a redfish session and then falls back to basic auth?

IMHO the root Sushy object should offer this in a configurable way thru its constructor parameters (if at all it offers this session-based auth and fallback to basic-auth in case of failure).

    class Sushy:
      ...
      def __init__(self, base_url, username=None, password=None,
                   root_prefix='/redfish/v1/', verify=True,
                   authn_mode=BASIC_AUTH_ONLY):
        ...

where authn_mode can take constant values as:

    BASIC_AUTHN_ONLY
    SESSION_AUTHN_ONLY  # it will fail in case session based authn fails
    SESSION_BASIC_AUTHN  # it will fallback to basic authn in case session based authn fails

(the naming of the c'tor param and constants are open for change, tho)"}, {'account_id': 26143, 'date': '2017-07-07 17:18:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Currently the implementation is, attempt Redfish Session, if unable to complete the creation of said session, fall-back to utilizing basic auth. 

I do like the idea of configuring it through the root sushy object and then defaulting it to SESSION_BASIC_AUTHN if no configuration is passed in. 

That being said, currently the API does not require a user to set their configuration for AUTH and it auto tries to do it for them. From the users perspective, having it seamless, while we handle all the logic seems better.'}, {'account_id': 26143, 'date': '2017-07-07 17:19:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

I would like to note that adding the configuration portion would be trivial, although, I'll wait for more feedback."}, {'account_id': 26143, 'date': '2017-07-11 02:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-11 02:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Verified-1

(10 comments)

I am trying to chalk out my suggestion here. Please follow along. There are 3 entities involved here:

1. Sushy object (or the root resource) - main.py
2. Connector object (which facilitates the REST API request/response) - connector.py
3. Auth object (the authenticator object) - auth.py

The tasks and traits of each one of the entities are as following:

Sushy object
------------
  - keeps a reference of both Connector and Auth objects
  - initializes the connector object
  - fetches the root resource response w/o any mode of authentication
  - enable the auth object to ``authenticate`` .. please see below for more details

Connector object
----------------
  - doesn't accept username/password any more.
  - adds 2 more methods named ``set_http_basic_auth`` and ``set_http_session_auth``. Those will be used by auth object to set the auth related params.
 
Auth object
-----------
  - accepts Sushy object (read root resource object to get hold of session service) and Connector object (to hit REST API) under ``set_context`` method.
  - new method ``authenticate()`` introduced. ``establish_session`` doesn't seem to be a proper name as in the case of basic authentication we don't create any session as such. How to re-authenticate when session gets timed out can be achieved easily with little bit of modifications.

Please see below for a vivid details..."}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2017-10-17 21:39:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 49:

@Yusef I have left my thoughts inline. Let me know what you think and carry it forward.'}, {'account_id': 26143, 'date': '2017-10-17 22:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 49:

 > this loss.
 > About this patch I have already posted a new patch-set addressing
 > most of my own concerns raised. Do you plan to take it up from
 > here? Some of the items which were pending are work on unit test
 > cases to increase the coverage, exception changes, etc.?

Thanks for your kind words. I can take care of this from here. My plan is to work on this the remainder of this sprint and the next sprint as the deadline is coming up. I can work to increase the coverage, exception changes etc, and I can restore functionality by wrapping the initialization of the SessionService class with the try/except.'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2018-01-11 08:18:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 54.'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2018-01-11 08:22:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 54:

'}, {'created': '2017-06-07 22:20:33.000000000', 'message': 'Implemented Redfish Sessions because some vendor implementations have disabled basic auth and require a Redfish Session to access any resources. This was done  by creating the SessionService, SessionCollection and Session functionality. An update to the connector was also required to maintain an active session through an X-Auth-Token placed in the header. This X-Auth-Token is generated on a session creation. Also implemented associated functionality to close the active session and close other connections (a possible use case is zombie connections). Unit tests have been updated as well.

Change-Id: I0874a481f5d25696b9ad6f7af30290e33c011b7d

added functionality to main to create a session, delete a session based on an identifier url, and to delete the active session. Also added functionality to retrieve a session collection, and a session.

Change-Id: I026d677d5f426d40500f6471b7318e0872a5346c

added test cases for testing session connection information and for ensuring that if we have a key we are adding it to the headers properly.

Change-Id: Ie2c2e6edf32ddb4eebed0570ff097ed4f7212d1b

added to main test case unit tests for the functionality I provided for sessionservice/session/ and sessioncollection.

Change-Id: Ib454c5c8e0c8455def5a3fff3b81cb7609466a1c

added sessionservice resource and json_samples for unittesting of the session and sessionservice

updated readme to include sessionmanagement to list of functionality

added note on utilizing sessions and provided examples

Change-Id: Ib8a7191bea0c2b4927c06463fe232ea419347fcb

changed some wording in usage

Change-Id: I240f7673e5a7bb86f5a3c9b1e1fcd9e19925a992

Created unittests for session, sessioncollection and sessionservice and modified json_samples for session and session_service

Change-Id: Ib513e0cf7261d3fde95729f5aa611c5397029436

added more to test cases

Change-Id: I39c8154751b8b5d8cd478e2e130ebdde3468beb0

added get_session_service function

Change-Id: I5650dc4b6f3abe19dc160dc07cc75a6f5b093658

added oem data.

Change-Id: I711d95ed88ccb1899ce6cbd05d18d3656b54a20f

checking if session_uri is our active one, if it is then we will reset the _conn key and uri.

Change-Id: I6623538383388caf1115a7c100b0f97e73df69d9

'}, {'created': '2017-06-08 16:31:50.000000000', 'message': 'Implemented Redfish Sessions

Implemented Redfish Sessions because some vendor implementations
have disabled basic auth and require a Redfish Session to access
resources.

This was done by creating the following objects:
SessionService, SessionCollection and Session.

An update to the connector was also required to maintain
an active session through an X-Auth-Token placed in the header.
This X-Auth-Token is generated on session creation and can
be deleted through the close_active_session, close_session
functions. You could also close the session by
acessing the session object and calling its .close()
method.
Unit tests have been updated accordingly.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1695972

Change-Id: I6623538383388caf1115a7c100b0f97e73df69d9
Implemented SessionService, SessionCollection and Session and modified
how connector works.

commit_message:
Implement Redfish Sessions

Implement Redfish Sessions because some vendor implementations
have disabled basic auth and require a Redfish Session to access
resources.

This was done by creating the following objects:
SessionService, SessionCollection and Session,
BasicAuth, SessionAuth, SessionOrBasicAuth

Session state is managed internally by ourselves.
Unit tests have been updated accordingly.

Closes-Bug: 1695972
Co-Authored-By: Debayan Ray <debayan.ray@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6623538383388caf1115a7c100b0f97e73df69d9

[{'created': '2018-01-11 19:32:03.000000000', 'message': 'Switched all jobs from q-qos to neutron-qos

There is no functional difference between two in how devstack plugin for
neutron is implemented; but using neutron-* name pattern allows gate to
enable lib/neutron instead of lib/neutron-legacy devstack library to
deploy neutron services, which is the plan for all next releases.

Depends-On: I2fbd7649b6ef312940dca704ed3ebdb1e2e93576
Change-Id: Icbc5c0590b501fbec3c0b9575c93bf9eec3b5340
'}]
commit_message:
Switched all jobs from q-qos to neutron-qos

There is no functional difference between two in how devstack plugin for
neutron is implemented; but using neutron-* name pattern allows gate to
enable lib/neutron instead of lib/neutron-legacy devstack library to
deploy neutron services, which is the plan for all next releases.

Depends-On: I2fbd7649b6ef312940dca704ed3ebdb1e2e93576
Change-Id: Icbc5c0590b501fbec3c0b9575c93bf9eec3b5340

commit_message:
deprecations: Deprecate support for '-py{N}' requirements

This has been marked as deprecated for a long time in the docs but
we've done nothing to indicate this from a code perspective. Fix this.

Change-Id: I916bf16773a2a2cffa3c352d5dba52e3fbc298c2
Fixes-Bug: #431529

commit_message:
Fix default role missing pip packages

The default role is missing keystoneauth1 and oslo.utils pip
packages. Both of them are needed by monasca-agent venv to work
and build properly.

Change-Id: I10f61ac70effdcb8758fd44c92d6248af6b4ce2d
Closes-Bug: #1736036

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: I653f7b73ded5a2648c2d519136e261d0ea81c1c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 12:22:00.000000000', 'message': 'Update paste, policy and rootwrap configurations 2017-12-19

The locations of the previously included templates have been
moved to the standard location used in all other roles. This
helps to allow the sources-branch-updater script be able to
automatically place the updated files processed from the
upstream git repositories.

As there is now a rootwrap filter file, the appropriate tasks
to create the directory and to add the file have been
implemented. A little clean-up of syntax of tasks near those
modified have been included.

Finally - to resolve the ansible-lint issue the use of
systemctl has been removed.

Change-Id: I9b64d5e99dc81a6f35d74c0366ee2bbe7d15d327
(cherry picked from commit f02127ab83d58bdf05f196da1aa7a8d1f2be2260)
'}]
commit_message:
Update paste, policy and rootwrap configurations 2017-12-19

The locations of the previously included templates have been
moved to the standard location used in all other roles. This
helps to allow the sources-branch-updater script be able to
automatically place the updated files processed from the
upstream git repositories.

As there is now a rootwrap filter file, the appropriate tasks
to create the directory and to add the file have been
implemented. A little clean-up of syntax of tasks near those
modified have been included.

Finally - to resolve the ansible-lint issue the use of
systemctl has been removed.

Change-Id: I9b64d5e99dc81a6f35d74c0366ee2bbe7d15d327
(cherry picked from commit f02127ab83d58bdf05f196da1aa7a8d1f2be2260)

subject: tests: test.yml: Use the 'slurp' module to get the SSH key
messages: [{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-01-15 15:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-15 16:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-01-15 17:36:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-01-16 12:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-16 14:42:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-01-17 13:27:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 15:23:46.000000000', 'message': 'tests: test.yml: Use the 'slurp' module to get the SSH key

The lookup() module no longer works with Ansible 2.4 for fetching the
root's SSH key as it fails with the following error:

fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {
    "msg": "An unhandled exception occurred while running the lookup
plugin 'file'. Error was a <class 'ansible.errors.AnsibleError'>,
original message: could not locate file in lookup: ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub"
}

Lets use the 'slurp' module which should work as expected.

Change-Id: If2127c8d4aacb37344f5c2435264aaa0669da618
'}, {'created': '2018-01-16 12:53:44.000000000', 'message': 'tests: test.yml: Use the 'slurp' module to get the SSH key

The lookup() module no longer works with Ansible 2.4 for fetching the
root's SSH key as it fails with the following error:

fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {
    "msg": "An unhandled exception occurred while running the lookup
plugin 'file'. Error was a <class 'ansible.errors.AnsibleError'>,
original message: could not locate file in lookup: ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub"
}

Lets use the 'slurp' module which should work as expected.

Change-Id: If2127c8d4aacb37344f5c2435264aaa0669da618
'}]
commit_message:
tests: test.yml: Use the 'slurp' module to get the SSH key

The lookup() module no longer works with Ansible 2.4 for fetching the
root's SSH key as it fails with the following error:

fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {
    "msg": "An unhandled exception occurred while running the lookup
plugin 'file'. Error was a <class 'ansible.errors.AnsibleError'>,
original message: could not locate file in lookup: ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub"
}

Lets use the 'slurp' module which should work as expected.

Change-Id: If2127c8d4aacb37344f5c2435264aaa0669da618

Build succeeded.

- kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-iscsi http://54.209.116.144/78/533778/1/check/kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-iscsi/06b6242 : SUCCESS in 1h 34m 16s
- kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-FC http://54.209.116.144/78/533778/1/check/kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-FC/70c5789 : SUCCESS in 1h 40m 30s'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-01-16 18:14:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-16 18:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The problem with this approach is there is still a race window. I looked at doing this first, but in order to eliminate the window and still keep testing that path we need to do something like my approach.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-16 18:27:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

And from my understanding, a given test class will always run under one worker. Either way, that path is still covered.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-01-17 11:10:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The issue is not a race condition but an isolation issue, and can be reproduced 100% of the time if you run test test_create_glance_client_with_protocol_https after test_create_glance_client_with_protocol_http the same worker and will never happen if these 2 tests are run on different workers.

The interference is both ways, so if the https test is run first and then the http one second, then it will be the http one that fails, since the problem is that the first test fills the cache variable.

In your approach you are reducing what the tests are checking, as we'll no longer be verifying that we pass the right cacert on https when creating the session.

If we reset the cached session to None on each test it will work perfectly all the time and there is no possible race condition, because if they run on the same worker they will be run serially and each of the tests will make sure that the cache is empty, thus ensuring that the load_from_options method is executed.  And if they run on different workers each worker has it's own cache variable (it is not shared among workers) so even without the fix it will work, and the fix won't change that."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-17 13:40:25.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Still disagree, but we need to stop everyone needing to recheck all the time.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 20:24:27.000000000', 'message': 'Remove racy assertion in glance client unit tests

We are seeing frequent unit test failures since the glance client
session was made a global in I4504a68c83e1e2110c27e62376968cfa1950cf46.
The tests assert on loading the config, but that will only happen
if the session has not been created yet.

This path can be hit in two tests. Rather than removing the assertion
completely, relying on unit test execution order [1] to keep the
assertion in the first run test so there is at least coverage.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.html#organizing-test-code

Change-Id: I3acb934146fc523aad6649d8465c15f2d9ee78a5
Closes-bug: #1743448
'}]
commit_message:
Remove racy assertion in glance client unit tests

We are seeing frequent unit test failures since the glance client
session was made a global in I4504a68c83e1e2110c27e62376968cfa1950cf46.
The tests assert on loading the config, but that will only happen
if the session has not been created yet.

This path can be hit in two tests. Rather than removing the assertion
completely, relying on unit test execution order [1] to keep the
assertion in the first run test so there is at least coverage.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.html#organizing-test-code

Change-Id: I3acb934146fc523aad6649d8465c15f2d9ee78a5
Closes-bug: #1743448

commit_message:
Support deploying extra nodes in te-broker

There are situations where we may need to deploy additional
undercloud-like nodes in a test environment.  Support for this has
been added to OVB and this commit wires it into the te-broker.

Change-Id: I84bfba3ee67cd5564ad0a4372c424a2622a97e6f

commit_message:
Add codes of sending parsed snmp trap to datasource

since there is no snmp triggered datasource, codes
of alarm datasource processing snmp event and config file
are added in test case.

Change-Id: I9a4f0c8405f52bf9269b0056d26b31fdafdad0aa
Implements: blueprint snmp-support
Signed-off-by: xupeipei <xu.peipei1@zte.com.cn>

commit_message:
Gate: Update heat templates to export floating IP

This PS updates the heat template to output the Floating IP, which
makes the gate scripts compatible with the current master clients
when used with newton images.

Change-Id: I8e429b504ede521612c91d7563a8c5e4953bdbb4

commit_message:
Fix stackviz data

In /opt/stack/new/ there is a tempest directory that is invalid, since
tripleo runs tempest in undercloud. We need to remove this tempest
directory, and copy the tempest from undercloud, so stackviz can be
processed properly.

Change-Id: Iaa3b3f5d9b99a5567ac5edc5d2f1ccd03077ee14

messages:
[{'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-01-06 10:05:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-01-07 08:05:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-08 05:00:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Thanks Chandan. some comments inline. And looks like its unable to import aodh_tempest_plugin in gate'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-01-08 05:30:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

other question is whether telemetry_tempest_plugin is available as pip in case someone run congress tests other than gate?

i mean we need to add telemetry_tempest_plugin as test_requirements.txt accordingly.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-08 19:42:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thank you Chandan and all.

The failure Anusha pointed out is here:
http://logs.openstack.org/34/531534/2/check/congress-devstack-api-mysql/90697a5/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-07_08_35_32_027251

I wonder where the gate job put the telemetry_tempest_plugin code that it is not accessible for import (unlike the aodh in-tree tempest plugin code).

Ghanshyam, from what I can gather, tempest plugins do not have releases. Is that right? In that case, it wouldn't make sense to have them in test-requirements."}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-01-09 03:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-09 05:57:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

@Chandan, Thanks. Could you please explain the fix, why can't we import aodh service client from telemetry tempest plugin. Here it seems to be additional dependency on ceilometer, which is not required in previous case."}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-01-09 16:52:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-01-09 16:53:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> @Chandan, Thanks. Could you please explain the fix, why can't we
 > import aodh service client from telemetry tempest plugin. Here it
 > seems to be additional dependency on ceilometer, which is not
 > required in previous case.

commit_message:
Use telemetry-tempest-plugin for aodh tests

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526299/ removes the aodh tempest
  plugin from aodh project and moves it to telemetry-tempest-plugin.
  Let's use the plugin to consume aodh tempest plugin pieces.

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532246/ adds devstack plugin for
  telemetry tempest plugin to install easily.

Depends-On: I3ac8516a0c15b0816c14074ec5119e317735edd6
Change-Id: Ibe7cbb320f9bca55d19ab3d307c6d2df374e7262

subject: Send correct number of X-Delete-At-* headers
messages:
[{'account_id': 17245, 'date': '2017-12-01 10:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17245, 'date': '2017-12-01 13:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2017-12-06 01:59:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Thanks for this patch, I think this is the right approach. I have not yet tested this functionally. I'd prefer the test to cover both policy types by being in the BaseObjectControllerMixin.

It's likely that we do not need a delete-at update to be sent to *all* backend object servers - as with the container updates, we should send at least the quorum. However, that change implies changing the object server which currently generates async updates when the delete-at-host etc headers are missing. I think it is ok to make the change proposed here and consider reducing the number of delete-at updates as a follow on change."}, {'account_id': 17245, 'date': '2017-12-06 15:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-06 01:25:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think the way to go is to only send enough container updates to ensure durability, and then make the object server stop trying to figure out container updates on its own.

This patch got me looking at how we do container updates today, and I think it's wrong, so I wrote this other patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531527/

Ideally, we'd send just as many requests with X-Delete-At-* as we do X-Container-*, and the object server would stop insisting on making an update to the expirer queue when it wasn't told to do so.

Does that seem reasonable, or do you think I've gone off the rails somewhere?"}, {'account_id': 17245, 'date': '2018-01-08 17:17:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I think the way to go is to only send enough container updates to
 > ensure durability, and then make the object server stop trying to
 > figure out container updates on its own.
 > 
 > This patch got me looking at how we do container updates today, and
 > I think it's wrong, so I wrote this other patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531527/
 > 
 > Ideally, we'd send just as many requests with X-Delete-At-* as we
 > do X-Container-*, and the object server would stop insisting on
 > making an update to the expirer queue when it wasn't told to do so.
 > 
 > Does that seem reasonable, or do you think I've gone off the rails
 > somewhere?

 > I think the way to go is to only send enough container updates to
 > ensure durability, and then make the object server stop trying to
 > figure out container updates on its own.
 > 
 > This patch got me looking at how we do container updates today, and
 > I think it's wrong, so I wrote this other patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531527/
 > 
 > Ideally, we'd send just as many requests with X-Delete-At-* as we
 > do X-Container-*, and the object server would stop insisting on
 > making an update to the expirer queue when it wasn't told to do so.
 > 
 > Does that seem reasonable, or do you think I've gone off the rails
 > somewhere?

I agree with you, and would like to use your method once/if your patch is/gets merged."}, {'account_id': 17245, 'date': '2018-01-12 16:23:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 17245, 'date': '2018-01-12 16:35:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I removed the  log warning and the handling of async update on its own of the object server.

This might be a problem in case of backwards compability, if a very old proxy is used  in combination with the most recent object server. But this should be very unlikely.

If strong backwards compability is required, we would need to make a condition, if only x-delete-at-partition is send without x-delete-at-container, and in this case still make the async update (as acoles mentioned in the bug page).'}, {'account_id': 17245, 'date': '2018-01-15 08:23:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17245, 'date': '2018-01-15 08:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-15 22:59:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This is looking pretty good, but I'd like to see the work distribution smoothed out a little more.

Consider an EC 6+3 policy with 3 container replicas. With this patch, object servers 1, 2, 3, and 4 each have a pair of container updates to do: one for the object's container and one for the expirer queue. Meanwhile, nodes 5-9 have no container updates at all.

To even out the load on the object servers a bit more, I'd rather see nodes 1-4 have the object's-container updates as they do today, nodes 5-8 have the expirer-queue updates, and node 9 nothing to do."}, {'account_id': 17245, 'date': '2018-01-16 11:02:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-17 00:25:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-01-17 01:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-01-17 01:37:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

I just wanted to fixup the commit message [1] so there was nothing hold this up, I'll put my +2 on it as a placeholder for Sam - I'm still looking at it."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-01-17 01:38:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

1. https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/REVIEW_GUIDELINES.rst#commit-messages'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-17 01:45:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

(7 comments)

Since Clay's still looking at it, I'll let him approve..."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-17 01:53:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

I'm still happy with it. Looks like patch set 7 just word-wrapped the commit message."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-01-17 04:10:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1

(1 comment)

Yeah you just count asyncs after writing an EC object - this is better than master

code all looks legit... test failures with code reverted at high quality

:shipit:'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-01-17 13:04:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}]

commit_message:
Send correct number of X-Delete-At-* headers

Send just as many requests with X-Delete-At-* as we do X-Container-* to
the object server.  Furthermore, stop the object server on making an
update to the expirer queue when it wasn't told to do so and remove the
log warning which would have been produced.

Reason:

It can be the case that the number of object replicas (OR) is larger
than the number of container replicas (CR) for a given storage policy
(most likely in case of EC).  Before this commit, only CR object servers
received the x-delete-at-* headers, which means that OR - CR object
servers did not receive the headers.  The servers missing the header
would produce a log warning and create the x-delete-at-container header
and async update on their own, which could lead to a bug, if the
expiring_objects_container_divisor option was misconfigured.

Change-Id: I20fc2f42f590fda995814a2fa7ba86019f9fddc1
Closes-Bug: #1733588

Same question as in another patch you have for infra repo removing the legacy jobs: what's our strategy for stable branches? They don't have the new jobs enabled, so just killing old ones for all branches will reduce test coverage for stable/*."}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2017-11-21 15:57:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Today I reviewed the zuulv3 migration guide and found the following section: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#stable-branches. Followed up with an IRC conversation with pabelanger and AJaeger of the infra team: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2017-11-21.log.html#t2017-11-21T15:29:19. So the answer to Ihar's questions is that the each stable branch has its own .zuul.yaml  and playbooks and the jobs have to be removed from here"}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2017-12-01 08:31:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-01-17 13:00:37.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:

commit_message:
Fluentd: Transform path by service

Currently, the configuration delivered via
service_config_settings does not provide the
transformation path regarding the logs for
containerized deployments. So logs are not
correctly configured on fluentd on containerized
deployments.

This path added this feature so the logs are
properly located on fluentd configuration.

Added unit test for this issue

Partial-bug: #1715187
Partial-bug: #1716427
Change-Id: Ie7df4b8b94cb0ae38096ab95800f211ef1cd8455

commit_message:
Configure ODL Logging mechanism

ODL logs to either console for containarised deployment and to file
for non-containarised deployment. For containarised deployments, logs
can then be read via "docker logs".

We need both JVM and karaf (ODL application) logs together to debug
any failure scenario and for them to correlate. JVM logs to console
and not to a file. Karaf can log to file and console. So we make
karaf and JVM both log to console and read these logs via docker logs.

In cases when ODL container restarts, "docker logs" retain logs from
previous broken container so there is no loss of logs in these cases.

Change-Id: I2fe56df082c5d9206015f156f5f1b3cfca63c982

commit_message:
Correct keystone-doctor tag name

Running keystone-doctor should only be done in the
config stage. It makes no sense to run when using
any other tag in isolation.

Change-Id: I782d8a9529ca32ccd413504b13c34cf1f972260d

commit_message:
Revert "Do not use warlock 1.3.0"

The fixes have propagated meanwhile, so we
should be good with allowing newer warlock.

This reverts commit 0e7a14a4f11ab22734724c60c824598be2fd7451.

Related-Bug: #1596573
Change-Id: I5551343914f43c7609e94ba307b4daae1d2004c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 19:14:20.000000000', 'message': 'Make haproxy stats refresh interval configurable

This patch adds a new variable, ``haproxy_stats_refresh_interval``,
which allows a deployer to configure their preferred refresh
interval for the haproxy stats page.

Release notes are included.

Closes-Bug: 1742526
Change-Id: I3979299478a8e9b479a4c4e821f2a45e1b2679cb
'}]
commit_message:
Make haproxy stats refresh interval configurable

This patch adds a new variable, ``haproxy_stats_refresh_interval``,
which allows a deployer to configure their preferred refresh
interval for the haproxy stats page.

Release notes are included.

Closes-Bug: 1742526
Change-Id: I3979299478a8e9b479a4c4e821f2a45e1b2679cb

commit_message:
use callback payloads for _SPAWN events

This patch switches callbacks over to the payload object style events
[1] for BEFORE_SPAWN and AFTER_SPAWN based notifications. As no event
data is passed for SPAWN notifications, an actual payload object is
not needed and thus this change uses publish() rather than notify()
and updates and callback receivers to accept the payload parameter.

Depends-On: Ifad4781d82aa07f213f4e075b0c9455aa95e94bb

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html#event-payloads

Change-Id: Iec1ed8b8fa203bd78681248766fb67bba98a68bd

commit_message:
Switch to neutron-tempest-plugin for tempest tests

*  https://review.openstack.org/519310 syncs the code from neutron
   project to neutron-tempest-plugin repo and it is better to
   depend on new one inorder to avoid the breakage.

Depends-On: I7282fa60db15427c73dfef84a40093904e083db2

Change-Id: I277aba00620ef67f7c24a601a8a2e46b4c99e3f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 08:59:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix error when using protocol number in security groups

When the support of protocol numbers in security groups
was fixed in [1], it introduced two deficiencies in the
iptables code:

- it was missing some protocols, for example, 'icmp', 'tcp'
  and 'udp', so when rules were added by number we did not
  use their name as iptables expects
- it used a dictionary to map numbers to names, but protocol
  numbers are stored as strings (i.e. '1' != 1)

Updated the iptables number mapping dict to have all
currently-known values, even those that are already well-known
and should have been using a string instead of a number.

Also changed the iptables number mapping dict to use
strings as the keys instead of numbers, since that's
what will be passed from the security group code.

Removed IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_MAP as it lives in neutron-lib,
and accidentally snuck-in in [1].

[1] I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87

Change-Id: I6b7575eb531b4f35579960c3feb47000cd259b86
Closes-Bug: 1719711
(cherry picked from commit 37bd42e4f5d1be49689032822aca339523cfda33)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix error when using protocol number in security groups

When the support of protocol numbers in security groups
was fixed in [1], it introduced two deficiencies in the
iptables code:

- it was missing some protocols, for example, 'icmp', 'tcp'
  and 'udp', so when rules were added by number we did not
  use their name as iptables expects
- it used a dictionary to map numbers to names, but protocol
  numbers are stored as strings (i.e. '1' != 1)

Updated the iptables number mapping dict to have all
currently-known values, even those that are already well-known
and should have been using a string instead of a number.

Also changed the iptables number mapping dict to use
strings as the keys instead of numbers, since that's
what will be passed from the security group code.

Removed IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_MAP as it lives in neutron-lib,
and accidentally snuck-in in [1].

[1] I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87

Change-Id: I6b7575eb531b4f35579960c3feb47000cd259b86
Closes-Bug: 1719711
(cherry picked from commit 37bd42e4f5d1be49689032822aca339523cfda33)

I didn't include much context in the commit message, but testtools project seems to be a sinking ship. It has seen its last meaningful update in April, and it breaks functionalities that are natively supported by Python's unittest standard library package.
Currently, we depend on testtools through osc_lib, and I hope it is only a matter of time until osc_lib will fork & ditch it."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-01-15 18:46:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Remove direct dependency on testtools

osc_lib is Openstack's standard for testing utilities
and in contrast to testtools, it is actively maintained.

tests/utils.py is a zombie file, and better version
of its content can be found in osc_lib.

Change-Id: Ib972bcab11f5b7239d98114364081281d2af2d46

commit_message:
When serializing an exception return its 'repr'

When serializing an exception return its 'repr'. A 'repr' is a
printable representation of an object.

For example the exception: ValueError("an exception") will be returned
as the string: "ValueError('an exception',)"

Change-Id: Iac9f4624bcc4ff65e27c9ca20c6cbbe9481cf334

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I3a6c85db180c25e360934ada60df7328ed7a765a

commit_message:
Fluentd plugins rpm installation on CentOS

Currently, fluentd plugins are installed via gem install,
this may causes some issues when gems are updated upstream.

This patch uses the plugins packaged on CentOS opstools
repository.

The debian/ubuntu image has not been modified

Change-Id: Ib32ceaae0d9fa56c6ec25a47ae6f44259d3b6e6d

subject: Remove shuffle_time_before_polling_task option
messages:
[{'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2017-11-23 09:44:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-23 13:57:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

why do have patches adding code that you remove here?lol'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2017-11-23 14:22:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

because I have no idea this one will fly or not. but the other one i'm sure will soâ€¦ :)

And the other one could also be cherry-picked since it's kinda a fix (min=0)"}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2017-11-23 19:04:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20223, 'date': '2017-11-24 01:30:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-27 16:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2017-11-27 17:15:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-27 22:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-27 22:55:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

summary: i don't think this works... nor do i think this ever worked :/

i feel like I12e3f104fc92fe15adc05e2b981627f31ee5bfaa is broken as is."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2017-11-28 09:52:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> what are A, B, C in your example? cpu, disk.read.bytes, network.read.bytes (or some combination)?

A, B and C are sources of samples.

> iiuc, this code is creating polling_tasks which contain all pollsters (cpu, disk.read.bytes, network.read.bytes, etc...) of same interval.

and same source.

> so your change with my polling.yaml will only have one item of interval 300s... so you are shuffling a single key (300), and thus it's just triggering right away.

Ok so one of us does not understand the problem. I'll assume it's you :-P

This is a *startup* problem. When Ceilometer starts, it *polls everything right away*. That's why we right now have this jitter aded, so the *right away* is *right away plusâ€¦ a few seconds*, to avoid congestion.

This only avoids congestion *on startup*. Then, it's free for all â€“ anyway there's no way to know how delayed they'll be in the future for whatever reasons AFAIK.

Now this patch removes that jitter by simply shuffling the order of the *first poll* so the congestion is also avoided on *first poll*, but without using a delay.

What do I miss?"}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-28 13:54:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

you missed my last message! :P

see the patch. see how the jitter it adds is only effective if you have multiple intervals.

what i believe you are trying to do is shuffle the order each individual pollster is activated on startup. yes? cool. well that's not what's happening. it's just shuffling the intervals."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2017-11-28 14:09:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> see the patch. see how the jitter it adds is only effective if you have multiple intervals.

Yes.

> what i believe you are trying to do is shuffle the order each individual pollster is activated on startup. yes? cool. 

No, i'm trying to replace the initial patch with something that does not require an option. IIUC what you want is to _enhance_ what is already there with a more complete feature. It's not the goal of this patch.

> well that's not what's happening. it's just shuffling the intervals.

and before it was just randomly delaying them IIUC"}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-28 14:16:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> and before it was just randomly delaying them IIUC

this ^. that's my point. i'm not saying your patch is wrong. i'm saying the patch from 3 years ago is wrong.lol

this patch just keeps it wrong which if that's the proposal, i don't see why you want to change something broken to stay broken."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2017-11-28 14:59:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

butâ€¦ it's not broken. it's just not doing what *you* want it to do.

i'm not trying to improve it, i'm trying to simplify it. :("}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-28 15:09:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

as discussed on irc. just add release note. better to remove the option since it's just provides false hope that this jitter actually works."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2017-11-29 15:00:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-29 16:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-30 16:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2017-12-08 14:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-12-08 19:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2017-12-09 11:39:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-12-11 22:52:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2017-12-12 14:47:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2018-01-16 11:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2018-01-16 13:32:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-01-17 10:32:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-23 09:44:08.000000000', 'message': "Replace shuffle_time_before_polling_task by random polling at startup

The problem that shuffle_time_before_polling_task tries to solve is the startup
of a horde of Ceilometer instances that would start polling the same thing at
the same time.

It's actually unlikely they would all start at the same right second, but in
the case where they would all start in the same time range, we here avoid this
problem by launching the first polling tasks in a random order. That makes sure
the load is spread sufficiently across different targets.

Change-Id: If8141f6b48657c06e8e782eeef9b209dabb2097c
"}, {'created': '2017-11-29 15:00:43.000000000', 'message': "Remove shuffle_time_before_polling_task option

The problem that shuffle_time_before_polling_task tries to solve is the startup
of a horde of Ceilometer instances that would start polling the same thing at
the same time.

It's actually unlikely they would all start at the same right second, and the
correct fix would be to do that each time.

Related-Bug: #1734898

Change-Id: If8141f6b48657c06e8e782eeef9b209dabb2097c
"}, {'created': '2017-12-08 14:54:56.000000000', 'message': "Remove shuffle_time_before_polling_task option

The problem that shuffle_time_before_polling_task tries to solve is the startup
of a horde of Ceilometer instances that would start polling the same thing at
the same time.

It's actually unlikely they would all start at the same right second, and the
correct fix would be to do that each time.

Related-Bug: #1734898

Change-Id: If8141f6b48657c06e8e782eeef9b209dabb2097c
"}, {'created': '2018-01-16 11:26:57.000000000', 'message': "Remove shuffle_time_before_polling_task option

The problem that shuffle_time_before_polling_task tries to solve is the startup
of a horde of Ceilometer instances that would start polling the same thing at

It's actually unlikely they would all start at the same right second, and the
correct fix would be to do that each time.

Related-Bug: #1734898

Change-Id: If8141f6b48657c06e8e782eeef9b209dabb2097c
"}]
commit_message:
Remove shuffle_time_before_polling_task option

The problem that shuffle_time_before_polling_task tries to solve is the startup
of a horde of Ceilometer instances that would start polling the same thing at
the same time.

It's actually unlikely they would all start at the same right second, and the
correct fix would be to do that each time.

Related-Bug: #1734898

Change-Id: If8141f6b48657c06e8e782eeef9b209dabb2097c

commit_message:
Add flag to configure VIPs

This flag determines whether or not we configure the VIP tunnels.
This is useful if we want to do the deployment in several passes.

commit_message:
Remove oslosphinx from docs

oslosphinx is obsolete and maintained up to Pike release.
openstackdocstheme is its replacement, and octavia-dashboard has
already switched to it (doc/source/conf.py:html_theme).

Change-Id: I283c24c16a40b706db3485054b7d41a158a14df3

commit_message:
network refactor for Pike and Chef 13

- implemented foodcritic and cookstyle corrections
- deprecated node.foo.bar method access for node['foo']['bar'] bracket syntax
- deduplicated resource calls for identity registration
- moved dpkg overrides to common cookbook for DRY

Implements blueprint modern-chef

Depends-On: I143e0ed0a2bdd76269fc0c402052696426d96d81
Change-Id: Ib268737d2f5c3196061d89202d806c3af1c54e72

commit_message:
mock: Fixes mock.patch.multiple autospec

mock.patch.multiple causes the patch result to be a dictionary,
which causes the autospec to fail. This patch will autospec
properly in this scenario as well.

Change-Id: I3aa97459bf53059422c8fa696cb09df811c1701b
Related-Bug: #1735588

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-08 09:46:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix callers of get_devices_with_ip() to pass addresses

If callers of get_devices_with_ip(), or
device.addr.list(to=address) pass an ip_cidr, it
could match any ip_cidr in that range on the interface.
Callers need to pass the IP without the prefix portion in
order to match it exactly.  Added a helper utility to
strip the cidr part from a ip_cidr.

Determined the unit test for this can't actually check
this case since we are mocking the return value from
/sbin/ip, so modified it to just make sure the dict
is correct.

Added a functional test that adds two IP addresses in
the same IP range to verify that we actually filter
correctly when a 'to=IP' is specified.

Change-Id: I3a95b3bb72a43f322ad23892d8959398aac22a1c
Closes-bug: #1728080
(cherry picked from commit 7b8289253c355f39ac84bc6ea36d265a8be0e381)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix callers of get_devices_with_ip() to pass addresses

If callers of get_devices_with_ip(), or
device.addr.list(to=address) pass an ip_cidr, it
could match any ip_cidr in that range on the interface.
Callers need to pass the IP without the prefix portion in
order to match it exactly.  Added a helper utility to
strip the cidr part from a ip_cidr.

Determined the unit test for this can't actually check
this case since we are mocking the return value from
/sbin/ip, so modified it to just make sure the dict
is correct.

Added a functional test that adds two IP addresses in
the same IP range to verify that we actually filter
correctly when a 'to=IP' is specified.

Change-Id: I3a95b3bb72a43f322ad23892d8959398aac22a1c
Closes-bug: #1728080
(cherry picked from commit 7b8289253c355f39ac84bc6ea36d265a8be0e381)
