subject: Add 'uuid' type
messages:
[{'account_id': 9311, 'date': '2017-12-18 01:52:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-01-04 11:06:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-15 15:13:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-01-15 15:19:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

these values were (initially at least) based on the JSON Schema 
base datatypes [1]

We could change this (and some projects already just do this [2]) - but we should call out that some types like ``uuid`` are based on the initial base set.

1 - http://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-core.html#rfc.section.4.2.1
2 - https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/dns/#list-zones'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-01-17 10:22:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

> these values were (initially at least) based on the JSON Schema

 >

 > 
 > 1 - http://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-core.html#rfc.section.4.2.1
 > 2 - https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/dns/#list-zones

Right, but we already support uuid, right? (We also seem to distinguish between float and int rather than just using number, but that's besides the point)"}]

commit_message:
blueprint for TCP Wrapper Service

This blueprint seeks to add a TripleO TCP Wrapper Service.

TCP Wrappers can provide an extra level of network security to TCP
wrapped services and is a check criteria for various security compliance
bodies such as DISA STIG and CIS.

This blueprint is centered on implementation of a puppet module and
TripleO service to ensure the TCP Wrapper package is present and running
and configure hosts.allow and hosts.deny with network access control
rules.

Change-Id: I7590493a94ec369f944aad94953e068615badc60

commit_message:
Update and replace http with https for doc links

1) Update doc links according to OpenStack document migration
2) Use https instead of http for docs links

commit_message:
Define entries of shard range db row in one place

Define the names and order of persisted shard range attributes in
one place to make code simpler and less error-prone. Also make
the transformation to a tuple less brittle.

Apart from cleaning up repetition of the keys, this change makes any
potential future changes to the key set easier.

Change-Id: I713a0bfb34547678904309df5f350dc33ca5f137

It means that the docker daemon can be started later.

Pass as a software deployment with the heat-agent the following
software-configurations:
* prometheus-monitoring

   compatible

Related-Bug: #1680900
Change-Id: I084b7fe51eddb7b36c74f9fe76cda37e8b48f646
(cherry picked from commit 273405cb5a8cdbcec816f646cfe82f13784b3bf1)
'}]
commit_message:
Leverage heat-container-agent for monitoring

Use the heat-container-agent from a system container.
It means that the docker daemon can be started later.

Pass as a software deployment with the heat-agent the following
software-configurations:
* prometheus-monitoring
** pin prometheus to v1.8.2 since its config is not 2.0.0
   compatible

Add heat-container-agent container image.

Implements: blueprint heat-agent
Related-Bug: #1680900
Change-Id: I084b7fe51eddb7b36c74f9fe76cda37e8b48f646
(cherry picked from commit 273405cb5a8cdbcec816f646cfe82f13784b3bf1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-17 09:15:17.000000000', 'message': "sync: Update renamed method usage

The Nova driver 'block_device_info_get_root' method has been renamed
to 'block_device_info_get_root_device', for which reason we're now
getting attribute errors when spawning instances.

This change updates the method call.

Change-Id: I811ca11d347a63556b66af3d5db1524fe325485e
"}]
commit_message:
sync: Update renamed method usage

The Nova driver 'block_device_info_get_root' method has been renamed
to 'block_device_info_get_root_device', for which reason we're now
getting attribute errors when spawning instances.

This change updates the method call.

Change-Id: I811ca11d347a63556b66af3d5db1524fe325485e

commit_message:
Set restrictive file permissions on Ceph keyrings for non-containerized deployment

Pass mode parameter 0640 and user and group ownership to puppet-ceph for
Ceph openstack client keyrings during non-containerized deployment.

Author:    Keith Schincke <kschinck@redhat.com>
Co-Author: John Fulton <fulton@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I0c1bc3d2362c6500b1a515d99f641f8c1468754a
Partial-Bug: #1720787
(cherry picked from commit bdf1ade1b9de994c3098fb17cca6dd64b3d14cd5)

Change-Id: Iccb24f5c2ee639ad2bc0869a37cec305f32b9fd1

subject: Listen on IPSEC connections at different times
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 16:19:25.000000000', 'message': 'Listen on IPSEC connections at different times

HAving all the nodes listen for connections at the same time leads
to race conditions. This introduces a random sleep before the
whack --listen directive.

Change-Id: If07a27fdc2fb58964acb98b67387c742f07ca34e
'}]
commit_message:
Listen on IPSEC connections at different times

HAving all the nodes listen for connections at the same time leads
to race conditions. This introduces a random sleep before the
whack --listen directive.

Change-Id: If07a27fdc2fb58964acb98b67387c742f07ca34e

https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/master/openstackdocstheme/__init__.py#L76'}, {'account_id': 16523, 'date': '2018-01-16 07:48:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

line 40-52 at https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/master/openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/script_footer.html#L40'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-16 08:30:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Fix the Neutron API Reference cannot derive source file URL

deal with it specially.

subject: Adding netflow support for br-int
messages:
[{'account_id': 27676, 'date': '2018-01-17 08:17:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-01-17 08:17:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27676, 'date': '2018-01-17 10:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

fixing some things'}]

commit_message:
Adding netflow support for br-int

Ask for the netflow target and then apply the netflow target to the
appropriate bridge (br-int for all traffic)

Change-Id: I975bafb546010f0281d81556529e871160d9ab15

subject: Dont insist on IKEv2
messages: [{'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-01-17 09:04:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-01-17 09:13:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-17 09:04:45.000000000', 'message': 'Dont insist on IKEv2

For some reason, using IKEv2 causes issues with tunnels
that are on the same network going to different hosts.

This commit leaves then the usage of IKEv2 only for
opportunistic IPSEC configurations.

Closes-Bug: #1743693
Change-Id: Ic1b1dfa86fd9fb328a197211b114cd39ee12da3f
'}]
commit_message:
Dont insist on IKEv2

For some reason, using IKEv2 causes issues with tunnels
that are on the same network going to different hosts.

This commit leaves then the usage of IKEv2 only for
opportunistic IPSEC configurations.

Closes-Bug: #1743693
Change-Id: Ic1b1dfa86fd9fb328a197211b114cd39ee12da3f

[{'created': '2017-12-31 18:03:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add traceback information into exception

When we re-raise exception we are losing trace information of previous
exception. This patch fixes situation by putting traceback info into
instance of exception so we can display it in logs on higher level
(e.g. CLI code) if debug mode is enabled

Change-Id: Iead6ea802483a981f8fd7c00c240c6c77437925b
'}, {'created': '2017-12-31 19:29:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add traceback information into exception

exception. This patch fixes situation by putting traceback info into
instance of exception so we can display it in logs on higher level
(e.g. CLI code) if debug mode is enabled

Exc.traceback is trace information on moment when exception is created
(it has different behavior from __traceback__ in PY3)

commit_message:
Add traceback information into exception

When we re-raise exception we are losing trace information of previous
exception. This patch fixes situation by putting traceback info into
instance of exception so we can display it in logs on higher level
(e.g. CLI code) if debug mode is enabled

Exc.traceback is trace information on moment when exception is created
(it has different behavior from __traceback__ in PY3)

Change-Id: Iead6ea802483a981f8fd7c00c240c6c77437925b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 03:32:24.000000000', 'message': "Rename 'SAHARA_AUTO_IP_ALLOCATION_ENABLED' config parameter

The 'SAHARA_AUTO_IP_ALLOCATION_ENABLED' config parameter in Sahara
is confusing with Nova Networking in horizon. In Sahara, this parameter
means 'use auto floating ip', in Nova Networking, this parameter means
'auto assign floating ip'.

Change-Id: Iadb558e9335cac368a340a470807d246a6699d5f
"}, {'created': '2018-01-05 02:20:42.000000000', 'message': "Rename 'SAHARA_AUTO_IP_ALLOCATION_ENABLED' config parameter

The 'SAHARA_AUTO_IP_ALLOCATION_ENABLED' config parameter in Sahara
is confusing. If you wish to disable floating IP options during node
group template creation, set it 'True', but this name sounds like it
has to do with automatically associating a floating IP. so we can
rename a meaningful variable name.

Change-Id: Iadb558e9335cac368a340a470807d246a6699d5f
"}]
commit_message:
Rename 'SAHARA_AUTO_IP_ALLOCATION_ENABLED' config parameter

The 'SAHARA_AUTO_IP_ALLOCATION_ENABLED' config parameter in Sahara
is confusing. If you wish to disable floating IP options during node
group template creation, set it 'True', but this name sounds like it
has to do with automatically associating a floating IP. so we can
rename a meaningful variable name.

Change-Id: Iadb558e9335cac368a340a470807d246a6699d5f

commit_message:
KubeADM-AIO: Move to upstream debian base image

This PS moves KubeADM-AIO to use the upstream debian base image
that is used to build the Kubernetes release images:
 * https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/tree/master/build/debian-base

By default Trove is looking for "RegionOne", if the region is
different the os_region_name parameter needs to be defined withing

commit_message:
Add os_region_name to Trove configuration files

By default Trove is looking for "RegionOne", if the region is
different the os_region_name parameter needs to be defined withing
the Trove configuration files.

To solve this issue, we need to set "os_region_name" option in
trove-api, trove-taskmanager and trove-conductor configuration.

os_region_name = {{ openstack_region_name }}

Change-Id: I1397046d2c88ba50d01a65c48e021d3535fe39d2
Closes-bug: #1743402

Presently the taskmanager failed during a creation
of a trove cluster.

During the network ip checks, it didn't match the network.

The idea is to configure it to match all network name.
Finally this configuration is the same as for trove.conf.

Closes-bug: #1743395
Change-Id: I9284501424e6daa7d33d1590994bf231de71edd9

commit_message:
Update network_label_regex on trove templates

Presently the taskmanager failed during a creation
of a trove cluster.

During the network ip checks, it didn't match the network.

The idea is to configure it to match all network name.
Finally this configuration is the same as for trove.conf.

Closes-bug: #1743395
Change-Id: I9284501424e6daa7d33d1590994bf231de71edd9

commit_message:
Remove the unnecessary gather facts

By default, the ansible task will gather facts, it can be configured by
set "father_facts: true", it's unncessary to run setup in tasks, it will
waste much time when hosts is large.

Change-Id: I9462a538c76b6271a34531d8752b72cc695f693e
Closes-Bug: #1743485

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-05 09:55:27.000000000', 'message': "Validate Dockerfile indentation in pep8

Delegate code style validation to computers, they're better than human
at it :)

This commit adds a new `tools/validate-indentation.sh` script that
errors when it finds an indented Dockerfile instruction, and enables
the validation in the pep8 check.

Also adjust the logic of `tools/validate-all-dockerfiles.sh` so that it
doesn't stop on first errors but instead shows all of them.

Fixes the remaining indentations in Dockerfiles.

Change-Id: I53c0d38304cb4f6d64a5dfab67f70d69b3eae587
"}]
commit_message:
Validate Dockerfile indentation in pep8

Delegate code style validation to computers, they're better than human
at it :)

This commit adds a new `tools/validate-indentation.sh` script that
errors when it finds an indented Dockerfile instruction, and enables
the validation in the pep8 check.

Also adjust the logic of `tools/validate-all-dockerfiles.sh` so that it
doesn't stop on first errors but instead shows all of them.

Fixes the remaining indentations in Dockerfiles.

Change-Id: I53c0d38304cb4f6d64a5dfab67f70d69b3eae587

commit_message:
Designate/Neutron communicaton failure

Designate communicate on publicURL (Default) endpoint with Neutron.
When TLS is enabled it generates errors (Missing certificate). We
need to ensure designate communicate with neutron on internalURL.

Closes-Bug: #1742625

commit_message:
Provide the correct directory to fetch the keys

Tacker is trying to fetch the keys from /etc/tacker/vim/fernet_keys, however
the correct directory is in the venv. We should provide that information in
tacker.conf otherwise it uses the default value which results in errors

Change-Id: I6bbdc4852df8c53dac73e3052af9c1046f216642

subject: Force restart IPSEC after config tasks
messages: [{'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-01-16 14:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-01-17 07:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 14:27:38.000000000', 'message': 'Force restart IPSEC after config tasks

The restart handler was getting run in between the configuration
loop per network. This is not desirable, as we needed it to run
after all that was done. This resulted in some tunnels not being
loaded which caused errors. Thus the need to manually trigger
a restart.

Change-Id: Id464d2b57ddb74471bf4693acaa4eed5fc003c9d
'}]
commit_message:
Force restart IPSEC after config tasks

The restart handler was getting run in between the configuration
loop per network. This is not desirable, as we needed it to run
after all that was done. This resulted in some tunnels not being
loaded which caused errors. Thus the need to manually trigger
a restart.

Change-Id: Id464d2b57ddb74471bf4693acaa4eed5fc003c9d

commit_message:
[placement] Add sending global request ID in delete (2)

Add the 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header in the request of DELETE.
When deleting allocations for a server (instance),
the header is added.

Subsequent patches will add the header in the other cases.

Change-Id: If38e4a6d49910f0aa5016e1bcb61aac2be416fa7
Partial-Bug: #1734625

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 06:22:31.000000000', 'message': 'Synology: Rename iSCSI target config options

Due to the NVMET target driver being implemented, five config options
(iscsi_ip_address, iscsi_port, iscsi_helper, iscsi_target_prefix, iscsi_protocol)
will be renamed (to target_ip_address, target_port, target_helper, target_prefix,
and target_protocol).
We keep compatibility with the old config options until they are safe to be
removed according to the current deprecation policy.

Change-Id: I356d44eeb904ab788427c8315c9ad5755802c90d
'}, {'created': '2018-01-09 06:25:38.000000000', 'message': 'Synology: Rename iSCSI target config options

Due to the NVMET target driver being implemented, five config options
(iscsi_ip_address, iscsi_port, iscsi_helper, iscsi_target_prefix, iscsi_protocol)
will be renamed (to target_ip_address, target_port, target_helper, target_prefix,
and target_protocol).
We keep compatibility with the old config options until they are safe to be
removed according to the current deprecation policy.

Related-Change: https://review.openstack.org/528515

Change-Id: I356d44eeb904ab788427c8315c9ad5755802c90d
'}, {'created': '2018-01-10 06:32:37.000000000', 'message': 'Synology: Rename iSCSI target config option

When the config option iscsi_ip_address was renamed to
target_ip_address, one place was missed.
Also updated the documentation and renamed related internal variable
names.

Change-Id: I356d44eeb904ab788427c8315c9ad5755802c90d
Related-Change: https://review.openstack.org/528515
'}]
commit_message:
Synology: Rename iSCSI target config option

When the config option iscsi_ip_address was renamed to
target_ip_address, one place was missed.
Also updated the documentation and renamed related internal variable
names.

Change-Id: I356d44eeb904ab788427c8315c9ad5755802c90d
Related-Change: https://review.openstack.org/528515

commit_message:
Use executable from sys path

As tempest tests are in seperate repo, relative path doesn't work,
let the executable be pick from the sys path instead

Partially-Implements blueprint split-tempest-plugin
Change-Id: Ie2a73e61c72a8822a49a2a50970d717cfdd86239

commit_message:
Add Enable/Disable User action for Angular users panel

To Test
 - set 'users_panel' to True in settings.py

Change-Id: I980d11e3ac5a3ee14dc253dc69dd7aeb40578cc2
Implements: blueprint ng-users

commit_message:
Add tests for X-Backend-Clean-Expiring-Object-Queue true

Check that when X-Backend-Clean-Expiring-Object-Queue is true
the object server does indeed call async_update.

Change-Id: I0a87979147591f15349b868a12ac6dd15ac4e37f
Related-Change: I4d64f4d1d107c437fd3c23e19160157fdafbcd42

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-09 20:40:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-09 20:51:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-10 00:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-01-10 05:13:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

@garyk,

Thanks for taking my advice to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527105/4/neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py@1386 into consideration. I still think that the DB base plugin should only be concerned with the DB operations of the core resources: networks, subnets, ports and subnetpools. It bothers me, though, that, as you correctly point out in the other patch, that we are forcing other plugins to implement these new filtering on their own. The root of the problem is that both in this patch and in 527105, we are trying to filter a GET ports, which in principle should be handled by the DB plugin, with references to other resources that are not at that level (security groups or extensions). So here's the outline of a possible solution:

1) Make _get_ports_query in https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py#L1368 to be similar to the extend_<resource>_dict methods, so it calls other _get_ports_query methods that register with it.

2) The other _get_ports_query can be implemented in modules under neutron/db. These modules will also take care with registering so they can be called by the _get_ports_query in the DB base plugin

3) Non core plugins can load the modules in point 2 when the corresponding extensions are configured

4) In the case of ML2, we will implement also ML2 extensions that will call the modules described in point 2. This way, they become configurable and knowable as extensions just be adding them to the 'extension_drivers' option in ml2_conf.ini

Since we are at the end of the cycle and the authors of this patch and 527105 might be interested in getting their functionality merged in Queens, we can let them proceed implementing in ML2 and we can implement the more generic solution outlined above early in Rocky. What do you think? Does it make sense to you?"}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-10 19:09:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-10 22:19:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-10 22:20:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-01-10 22:27:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1

Please see comments from riedem in-line. Also, I think we need the APIImpact tag in the commit message. It's not necessarily related to docs. Please see the include external references section in https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-01-10 22:31:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-01-11 01:30:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

As for the substring and prefix thing, I was thinking about the usecases about this feature, as IP addresses are not just string all digits, it had meanings from left to right, people will probably want to find all ports in one network range using "192.168.1", and this seems to be the real usecase for this feature, so I think it is different with the case "hypervisor name" as we are trying to find hypervisor name include some words. But, as we full substring is more generic, other projects are doing it and it can cover the usecase I mentioned, I'm OK with the full substring matching.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-01-11 14:08:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

RE: "Also, I think we need the APIImpact tag in the commit message."

I don't believe we do want to use the APIImpact tag here. If we do then an new bug will get created for the api-ref when this patch merges... We don't need this bug, as mentioned earlier the API ref is already addressed in I97259b85a2dce5a54bb6ea2cb9d9779ec0a25504 so creating one just seems to be noise to me.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-11 15:30:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

Let's do the full substring."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-11 15:41:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-11 15:44:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-11 15:49:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

> RE: "Also, I think we need the APIImpact tag in the commit
 > message."
 > 
 > I don't believe we do want to use the APIImpact tag here. If we do
 > then an new bug will get created for the api-ref when this patch
 > merges... We don't need this bug, as mentioned earlier the API ref
 > is already addressed in I97259b85a2dce5a54bb6ea2cb9d9779ec0a25504
 > so creating one just seems to be noise to me.

Per my understanding of the guidance [1], it seems the tag is required for this patch. If the tag created a bug, I will close it with a reference to the neutron-lib patch.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Including_external_references'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-11 20:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

[{'created': '2017-11-20 23:33:41.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Support like filtering port with IP address

Neutron currently supports filtering ports by matching the exact
IP address. This patch adds support for regex matching using "LIKE"
SQL operator. If users want to match the exact IP address, they can
continue to use the exact IP address (e.g. '10.0.0.3') as before.
For whom wants to use regex matching, they can use wildcards in
"LIKE" operator (e.g. '10.0.0.%').

Change-Id: I9549b2ba676e1bad0812682c3f3f3c97de15f5f6
Closes-Bug: #1718605

commit_message:
Support filtering port with IP address substring

Neutron currently supports filtering ports by matching the exact
IP address. This patch adds support for substring matching using
"LIKE" SQL operator.

This patch also added a new API extension to show whether or not
the substring matching capability is available.

APIImpact add IP address substring filtering on listing ports
API-ref: I97259b85a2dce5a54bb6ea2cb9d9779ec0a25504

Co-Authored-By: Zhenyu Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I9549b2ba676e1bad0812682c3f3f3c97de15f5f6
Closes-Bug: #1718605

commit_message:
expirer: unexpected responses don't warrant tracebacks

If you want more information, you need to go check out the *other* node.

Maybe this should be further refined to only log at debug for specific
statuses like 404 and 412?

Partial-Bug: 1688558
Related-Bug: 1455221
Change-Id: Ieefd8841154faba40dcf2a03abc5f056bdccd54f

Nice

With patch:

Without patch:

commit_message:
remove neutron.callbacks package

Neutron lib contains the latest callbacks and thus this patch removes
the callbacks package from neutron entirely.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I14e45fd5d2d3c816bb39f8ace56f7be460bac0d6

subject: Add a note about the cost of COPY for setting metadata
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-16 17:33:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2018-01-16 17:35:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 17:33:21.000000000', 'message': "Add a note about the cost of COPY for setting metadata

The pointer to using COPY to the same object as a mechanism to set only
a subset of the metadata, it does not mention that doing so results in
a full copy of the object in question on the backend.

Add a note so it's clear that there is a tradeoff involved.

Change-Id: I0c20a4909a6c3ff672f753d26cb9fb2f5f33d1f4
"}]
commit_message:
Add a note about the cost of COPY for setting metadata

The pointer to using COPY to the same object as a mechanism to set only
a subset of the metadata, it does not mention that doing so results in
a full copy of the object in question on the backend.

Add a note so it's clear that there is a tradeoff involved.

Change-Id: I0c20a4909a6c3ff672f753d26cb9fb2f5f33d1f4

commit_message:
Add copy method to ShardRange

...with option to reset all timestamps.

Use the copy method when bumping the timestamp of a newly found shard
range prior to persisting it. Previously only the created time was
bumped, leaving the meta_timestamp strangely older.

Change-Id: I684c0b97dbe8da8c5b91daeda7e8717ac4622b7c

hyper-v: Deprecates support for Windows / Hyper-V Server 2012

Starting with Rocky, we will support only Windows / Hyper-V Server
2012 R2 or newer.

commit_message:
devstack: added new neutron-* aliases for services

All services except q-sriov-agt now have their neutron-* counterparts.
The only service left behind is the SRIOV agent since it's not critical
to cover it right now, because it's not deployed in gate with the new
lib/neutron code.

Change-Id: I2fbd7649b6ef312940dca704ed3ebdb1e2e93576
Co-Authored-By: YAMAMOTO Takashi <yamamoto@midokura.com>
(cherry picked from commit 67ccaadd4d6558924d617ab3681472ff0cd6fe20)

commit_message:
Option to configure pip source for murano-agent

With this small changes it becomes possible to instruct murano to
provision murano-agent of version other than latest, or from
custom git branch or from a http source.

Use cases:
* Use agent with custom modifications that are not available in
  PyPI version
* Development of new agent features - agent can be installed from
  the private git repo
* Environments without internet connectivity

Change-Id: Icbea95abf070ef35781474a54461cc34bb9927af

[{'created': '2017-08-17 17:04:02.000000000', 'message': "Use sample environments for OVB configuration

Previously OVB was configured using a monolithic environment file
that had to contain all of the parameters and resource_registry
entries needed for the stack.  Recently support was added for a more
TripleO-like system of sample environment files, which makes the
configuration of OVB much cleaner.  While the old method will be
supported for a period of time, we should go ahead and switch to the
new method because the old one is now deprecated.

The role files unfortunately do not support this sort of configuration
yet, but while working on this change I remembered that roles
inherit their configuration from the parent stack so we don't
actually need to duplicate the network-isolation resource_registry
entries in the role file.  This simplifies the configuration quite a
bit too.

Change-Id: Iab6db834d587081f13c35b5270f15187b0b5fb3b

commit_message:
Use sample environments for OVB configuration

Previously OVB was configured using a monolithic environment file
that had to contain all of the parameters and resource_registry
entries needed for the stack.  Recently support was added for a more
TripleO-like system of sample environment files, which makes the
configuration of OVB much cleaner.  While the old method will be
supported for a period of time, we should go ahead and switch to the
new method because the old one is now deprecated.

The role files unfortunately do not support this sort of configuration
yet, but while working on this change I remembered that roles
inherit their configuration from the parent stack so we don't
actually need to duplicate the network-isolation resource_registry
entries in the role file.  This simplifies the configuration quite a
bit too.

Change-Id: Iab6db834d587081f13c35b5270f15187b0b5fb3b

commit_message:
Show resource usages for application

Show them in the description section right under the Flavor field
title (as quota usages + predicted increment progress bar).

Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Artem Tiumentcev <darland.maik@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Bump constraints for osc-lib to 1.9.0

This fixes some critical bugs required for heat octavia
patches.

Change-Id: I7610e700cd845ae3bdb109c90a13ad6a02c5dab1

commit_message:
Add additional context to contribution guide

Write down our relatively unwritten context of what
expectations exist for contributions and timelines
related to contributions.

Also performed some minor updates and added a note for
future document revision in the Rocky cycle.

Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <ruby.loo@intel.com>
Change-Id: I2d80043f0556a28fe355034ca66883384c408710

commit_message:
In NS delete, proactively detect if no VNF exist.

Proactively detect for VNFs in NS, if no vnf_ids exists, its
meaningless to execute delete workflow.

Change-Id: Iac66ed2c9fcb5c450c21270d8f843cf1f2bcd6ea
Closes-Bug: #1742128

commit_message:
ops-messaging refactor for Pike and Chef 13

- implemented foodcritic and cookstyle corrections
- deprecated node.foo.bar method access for node['foo']['bar'] bracket access
- updated for the most recent upstream rabbitmq cookbook

Implements blueprint modern-chef

Change-Id: If971a472c1fd9149a891200548a267655620fce2
Depends-On: I143e0ed0a2bdd76269fc0c402052696426d96d81

commit_message:
func tests for nested providers in alloc candidate

Adds a functional test for nested resource providers in the response
from GET /allocation_candidates. The tests assertions are marked with
TODOs for how the response *should* look like once
AllocationCandidates.get_by_requests() properly handles provider trees.

Change-Id: I8606b29149962bd250c81cb1d20c7029aa6f5b6a
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-30 12:43:39.000000000', 'message': "Create volumes for Bifrost's persistent data

Using Docker volumes for persistent data in the bifrost container is
necessary for upgrading the bifrost services.

This change adds the following volumes:

* bifrost_httpboot
* bifrost_ironic
* bifrost_mariadb
* bifrost_rabbitmq
* bifrost_tftpboot

Ironic creates hardlinks between the TFTP master image store and the
HTTP root path when iPXE is enabled. With different Docker volumes
used for these locations we run into
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1507894 during deployment. If
we use a directory under /httpboot to store the master images this
issue is avoided.

Change-Id: I8653268d3598e7a59d2eb45c8750d45b6fc9e35f
Partially-implements: blueprint bifrost-upgrade
"}, {'created': '2017-12-30 20:04:39.000000000', 'message': "Create volumes for Bifrost's persistent data

Change-Id: I8653268d3598e7a59d2eb45c8750d45b6fc9e35f
Partially-implements: blueprint bifrost-upgrade
"}]
commit_message:
Create volumes for Bifrost's persistent data

Using Docker volumes for persistent data in the bifrost container is
necessary for upgrading the bifrost services.

This change adds the following volumes:

* bifrost_httpboot
* bifrost_ironic
* bifrost_mariadb
* bifrost_rabbitmq
* bifrost_tftpboot

Ironic creates hardlinks between the TFTP master image store and the
HTTP root path when iPXE is enabled. With different Docker volumes
used for these locations we run into
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1507894 during deployment. If
we use a directory under /httpboot to store the master images this
issue is avoided.

Change-Id: I8653268d3598e7a59d2eb45c8750d45b6fc9e35f
Partially-implements: blueprint bifrost-upgrade

commit_message:
Fluentd: fix Mariadb mysqld_safe log not match

The following warning logs appears in fluentd container:

[warn]: pattern not match: "170908 21:34:12 mysqld_safe Starting mysqld daemon with databases from /var/lib/mysql/"

This patch fix it

Change-Id: I9820b8c5fd3456ba9c032fdf326c65632d147e50
Closes-Bug: #1708571
(cherry picked from commit 4bce67c540a0f913d4dd3a974c6b674cea42d5fe)

"}, {'created': '2018-01-04 11:05:35.000000000', 'message': "dev mode: Add support for keystone

Provide support fot kolla dev mode in Keystone. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'keystone_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of Keystone project is cloned
and bindmounted.

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for keystone

Provide support fot kolla dev mode in Keystone. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'keystone_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of Keystone project is cloned
and bindmounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: Ie4cf401ecd9a507e739a53dfdf16f65292ab57e5

commit_message:
Use push_destination as the registry host in env file

When using the undercloud registry, the prepare call needs to be run
twice, once to generate the upload instructions file, and again with a
different --namespace to generate the environment file.

This can be combined into a single call by modifying the env
paramaters by replacing the host portion of the registry path to use
push_destination. That is what this change does.

Change-Id: I7ad0ae8dee665c8c7d0599eb6d29787bf9043762
Closes-Bug: #1738663

commit_message:
[APIv2]Enable APIv2, experimentally

Pretty much all the changes from v1->v2 regarding REST semantics,
payload changes, etc have been completed.

So let's enable APIv2 in an experimental state. It will be needed for
exposing some new Sahara features like force-delete, decomission of
a specific node, and hopefully more.

bp v2-api-experimental-impl

Depends-On: I8397ed7c134f0742de8c38466ed3f9035d8103d4
Depends-On: I102fb2ad16d0256e3a9aa364586332a13826cc90
Change-Id: I6ee89d52ab6679c34f0a089df4b111796922e171

commit_message:
Move more prepare logic into kolla_builder

This moves logic out of tripleoclient so that container image prepare
operations can be performed with the CLI or with the UI via a
workflow.

Change-Id: I348f711a6dc2e4d8da7c61c28e81adbc77187dc0
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
Run kibana behind apache

Run kibana behind apache as a reverse proxy to supply basic auth
for kibana, as xpack requires a suscription to support security
for kibana

Change-Id: I82168fc47fad29e26bcb02964709a04200dac467

subject: Add "*.swp" to ".gitignore" file
messages: [{'account_id': 14151, 'date': '2018-01-02 14:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-01-17 02:13:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2\n\n.swp file is mostly Vim-specific. Additionally, because .swp file is hidden, some developers may prefer to use `git status` to determine their presence (and not `ls -a`, which is a much rarer command). Also, you can also just make a global gitignore if this kind of file is really a problem.'}, {'account_id': 14151, 'date': '2018-01-17 02:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

> @Dai Dang Van

Yep, it just my opinion, I thought that we should have something like a suggestion for operators in case they want to customize polices but I'm Ok too if Zaqar don't want to push it in installation guide for simplicity :D"}, {'account_id': 14203, 'date': '2018-01-15 07:37:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14203, 'date': '2018-01-15 07:52:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Run elasticsearch behind apache

Run elasticsearch behind apache as a reverse proxy to supply basic
auth for elasticsearch, as xpack requires a suscription to support
security for elasticsearch

Hi! Sorry about the blueprint, I think the problem is that the Cloudkitty project doesn't seem to be attached to the Openstack namespace on launchpad. We will have to fix this!

Other than that, I think it's all good, except for the Keystone tenant_fetcher : getting the list of all users for each tenant could have a big performance impact. Maybe there's a better way with the keystone domains?

As for the duplicate code in the sqlalchemy storage, I don't think the get_total method is accessed by anything else than the API. I think it could be safe to just add an user_id=None argument to this method and move the filter in-there. This way, we still have the /v1/report/total_by_tenant_and_user API call BUT we dont duplicate code on the DB layer. What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 21797, 'date': '2016-08-14 12:02:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Thanks,Guillaume.
I will take them all in consideration and try to improve the "keystone_fetcher" performance.'}, {'account_id': 21797, 'date': '2016-08-15 07:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 21797, 'date': '2016-08-15 07:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

Hi Guillaume, I've change the code as you suggest.
Reuse "get_total" function and improve the "get_tenant_member" method.
Looking forward to your review.
Thanks. :)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-08-15 07:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Verified+1

[{'created': '2016-08-02 04:01:22.000000000', 'message': 'Get total price by tenant_id and user_id. Ceilometer_collector

commit_message:
Get total price by tenant_id and user_id

Currently we have an API called "get_total" which
can get total consumption based on a tenant.
However, it's common desire to get consumption for
a specific user. This CR implements that.
Ceilometer_collector collects resources by tenant and user.
And write each frame into database. So we can fetch frame
based on a tenant and a user.

Implements: blueprint get-total-price-by-tenant-and-user
Change-Id: I9bb41e3ddb233a7c3d948dd0136df66661ac7a53

commit_message:
Spec of bp support-md5-of-body support

Now, Zaqar will add a non-URL-encoded message body MD5 validation function.
This is essential for the security of the message body, it can prevent the
message from being tampered.

Change-Id: Ic01e37be1ab59a42d10c53ffadfb6569ffccce2b
blueprint: support-md5-of-body

commit_message:
Nova: Add configdrive profile to bindep

This PS adds support for nova compute to generate the metadata
ISO image when use of the configuration drive is forced.

Change-Id: Ie5de7ba7fc81e78dcb78e2232385e8b99fe9cbcc

commit_message:
Implement controller logic for system group assignments

This commit wires up the remaining bits to expose system role
assignments for groups via the assignment API.

bp system-scope

Change-Id: I5051aa97dbecb88ee706749b26a4140f9798e084

[{'created': '2018-01-09 07:51:41.000000000', 'message': "Fix rally timeouts for trunk scenario test

While things may have become generally slower for reasons still
to be determined at the time this patch was developed, we noticed
that enforcing MTU rules between subports and trunk parent was
done by performing one DB lookup per subport. This patch optmizes
the performance by piggybacking on the logic that is used to
retrieve the subport underlying network's segmentation type when
the segmentation type must be inherited.

Closes-bug: #1741954

Change-Id: Ib18427ef7a3509088eaf8fa0cfed3fb659b6baea

commit_message:
Speed up trunk MTU enforcement check

While things may have become generally slower for reasons still
to be determined at the time this patch was developed, we noticed
that enforcing MTU rules between subports and trunk parent was
done by performing one DB lookup per subport. This patch optmizes
the performance by piggybacking on the logic that is used to
retrieve the subport underlying network's segmentation type when
the segmentation type must be inherited.

Closes-bug: #1741954

Change-Id: Ib18427ef7a3509088eaf8fa0cfed3fb659b6baea

commit_message:
Fix missing rps in allocation candidates

Some resource providers were not in allocation candidates
because it is deleted during SQL query in get_all_with_shared()
function.

This patch changes get_all_with_shared() function not to use
conditions with non-existing parameter when outer-join tables.

By this change, bug-1705231 is fixed without considering the
order of INNER JOIN and OUTER JOINs.

Closes-Bug:#1705231
Related-Bug:#1731072
Change-Id: If8c1717c950a29b87cc22ea32d679a6289614067

commit_message:
Align overcloud upgrade repo conf to new policy on promotion.

It was acted that we shouldnâ€™t wait for promotion for selected tripleo
package in this review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533715/.

This change apply that new policy to the upgrade process.

Change-Id: I36de7dfd404ca78c49ac8d05d4a64dab5def8ece

commit_message:
Keep the consistency of the field "tenant_id" for comparison in "create_bgpvpn_port_association()".

With comparison between port['tenant_id'] and bgpvpn['project_id'],
It should to be keeped the consistency of the field "tenant_id".

commit_message:
Activate config-download for ovb-ha

Migrates the ovb-ha job to use the config-download deploy mechanism.

Change-Id: I88cd74a592940b6fda5ffcf8dcc891b8da92cc59

commit_message:
WIP Add Blazar support to Heat

Add OS::Blazar::Lease, OS::Blazar::Host and the relevant modules to
support Blazar which is a resource reservation services in OpenStack.

Change-Id: Iec46db7accf965580048e3f3d10d7108fff65a36

commit_message:
Export env variables required for statistics

When calculation job statistics we need a few environemnt vars
be available in post playbook. Write them to file and export
when running logs collection role in post playbook.

Change-Id: I2719999a7f3abda43ab322a23bbe4750c7233a76

commit_message:
Merge user and users sections of the docs

The openstack doc standard location is 'user', so go with that.
Incorporate pages from the shade and occ docs into the appropriate
places in the user index file.

This still leaves user/logging and user/guide/logging which need to be
rationalized. That will come in the next commit, as it also needs to
actually rationalize the logging helper functions.

Remove the Makefile, as it's not used by things.

Change-Id: I26f36370ef9651f4bcaa7dee3b903309463d9592

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 08:59:45.000000000', 'message': 'Support protocol numbers in security group API

Somewhere along the way we broke supporting numbers in
the security group API that were not in our known list
of protocols.  In order to fix this properly we must
use the correct arguments when using iptables-save, as
it could use a name instead of a number, or vice-versa.
Determined the list of mappings by doing:

 for num in {0..255}; do iptables -A INPUT -p $num; done
 # iptables-save

Change-Id: I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87
Closes-bug: #1716045
Closes-bug: #1716790
(cherry picked from commit 7ff492c5bb9ce9f24f12db40c8e3a33beb47f87b)
'}]
commit_message:
Support protocol numbers in security group API

Somewhere along the way we broke supporting numbers in
the security group API that were not in our known list
of protocols.  In order to fix this properly we must
use the correct arguments when using iptables-save, as
it could use a name instead of a number, or vice-versa.
Determined the list of mappings by doing:

 for num in {0..255}; do iptables -A INPUT -p $num; done
 # iptables-save

Change-Id: I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87
Closes-bug: #1716045
Closes-bug: #1716790
(cherry picked from commit 7ff492c5bb9ce9f24f12db40c8e3a33beb47f87b)

I think this is incompatible with the following patch - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526968 - if we make this request first reject having a "name" property and then start accepting it that's an API break. It might be okay if it's first changed to allow a name property and then the schema is fixed to allow no other properties.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-12-19 20:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I think this is incompatible with the following patch -
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526968 - if we make this request
 > first reject having a "name" property and then start accepting it
 > that's an API break. It might be okay if it's first changed to
 > allow a name property and then the schema is fixed to allow no
 > other properties.

Alternatively, as Gage suggested on IRC, maybe these changes could be combined? So allow the name parameter and restrict garbage parameters (with the accompanying test) all in one change?'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2017-12-19 21:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> > I think this is incompatible with the following patch -
 > > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526968 - if we make this request

 > > that's an API break. It might be okay if it's first changed to

 > > other properties.
 > 
 > Alternatively, as Gage suggested on IRC, maybe these changes could
 > be combined? So allow the name parameter and restrict garbage
 > parameters (with the accompanying test) all in one change?

++ I think combining the changes would avoid any weird interactions with schema where having a name is not valid in one change, and allowed in another'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-12-20 01:17:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> > > I think this is incompatible with the following patch -

 > ++ I think combining the changes would avoid any weird interactions

commit_message:
Add schema check for authorize request token

This patch add the schema check for authorize
request token API. It'll avoiding some 500 error
caused by invalid input format and it will raise
400 error correctly.

This patch also add role name support for
authorize request token

Closes-bug: #1736875
Change-Id: I9d113692702e7aaa0127ffa9405a17908c0c6ff7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 10:17:30.000000000', 'message': 'Enable py36 unit tests in tox

With the current super-explicit version of tox.ini, it is not possible
to run tox -epy<any version> and have tests discovered and run. This
is because the default testenv does not run tests. Therefore, the
easiest way to add another version is to simply add another testenv,
as done in this change.

Python3.6 is the default Python3 on recent distributions so it needs
to be present if people are expected to be able to run python3 unit
tests before pushing their changes.

Change-Id: I728e482af3142bb101fc6bf52ec7926e29a42594
'}]
commit_message:
Enable py36 unit tests in tox

With the current super-explicit version of tox.ini, it is not possible
to run tox -epy<any version> and have tests discovered and run. This
is because the default testenv does not run tests. Therefore, the
easiest way to add another version is to simply add another testenv,
as done in this change.

Python3.6 is the default Python3 on recent distributions so it needs
to be present if people are expected to be able to run python3 unit
tests before pushing their changes.

Change-Id: I728e482af3142bb101fc6bf52ec7926e29a42594

commit_message:
Migrate to override_role for identity v2 module

Now that override_role has supplanted switch_role (which has
been deprecated) in [0], the RBAC tests need to switch to use
override_role.

This PS switches to override_role for the identity ve module.
This patch handles all the remaining modules for identity v2.

[0] I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: Ia8c0a465e906239e1572fdda2eceea820328faa8

commit_message:
Configuration drive format parameter includes invalid option

The config_drive_format parameter example includes an extra value which
causes the deployment environment to not be set correctly in nova.conf.

Change-Id: I9d035f2686f57b685cb5fae891a5b919ea2573cd
Closes-bug: #1665976

[{'created': '2018-01-16 14:37:10.000000000', 'message': 'add global python settings to multinode call

One can use virtenv with multinode.  Without
using the global python environment a user
will hit libselinux-python errors.

Closes-Bug: #1743140
Change-Id: I3c90f98cf2ef3d748fb695a26094f5201bd8fb67
'}]
commit_message:
add global python settings to multinode call

One can use virtenv with multinode.  Without
using the global python environment a user
will hit libselinux-python errors.

Closes-Bug: #1743140
Change-Id: I3c90f98cf2ef3d748fb695a26094f5201bd8fb67

commit_message:
Get the config for update outside of package update

Manage the config outside of the package update
tasks. Mistral doesn't wait for the heat stack update
to finish so we config uploaded to swift can be
different is heat stack update is not finished

Closes-Bug: #1738142

Change-Id: I8a92e4f4cfe8e3567e71f9ab60b4aef4142c3874
(cherry picked from commit a5a4434f378d89b9602ab8fb38f69ac3bfc66dc8)

commit_message:
List ansible/ansible in required-projects

The ansible-devel functional test intends to run against tip of ansible
devel. Let Zuul handle that and depends-on once cross-source depends
exist by listing ansible/ansible as a required-project.

Remove the special install handling, as tox-install-siblings should be
taking care of it now.

Change-Id: I93459ffc116f9106d9eb8000a7e5a58bea507308
Depends-On: Ib5e35315fc9ffe6fa8873ad4975309d9820e1feb
Depends-On: I6d234247e3d45befd264e159c8b0fe77f01c7fdc

commit_message:
Add unreleased library reporting to PROCESS.rst

Call out running the unreleased library report during the cycle to
make sure we are aware and can notify projects with pending library
changes before the end of the cycle.

Change-Id: Ib9fc72e01bb1914784253e3120e5eec0f850b76c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 22:07:16.000000000', 'message': "Switch rally job from q-* to neutron-* service names

When at least one service named as q-* is present in ENABLED_SERVICES,
then devstack utilizes lib/neutron-legacy to configure services
regardless of how other services are deployed (e.g. with lib/neutron).
This breaks deployment using lib/neutron.

Switching to new names doesn't change anything substantial because
devstack plugin equally handles both variants. It allows to use new
devstack neutron library though.

Change-Id: Id0d35523651131766a70e78bf130205c1c63acd5
(cherry picked from commit 661247a61708d9ceb716e0778ec0c83345ddd3ba)
"}]
commit_message:
Switch rally job from q-* to neutron-* service names

When at least one service named as q-* is present in ENABLED_SERVICES,
then devstack utilizes lib/neutron-legacy to configure services
regardless of how other services are deployed (e.g. with lib/neutron).
This breaks deployment using lib/neutron.

Switching to new names doesn't change anything substantial because
devstack plugin equally handles both variants. It allows to use new
devstack neutron library though.

Change-Id: Id0d35523651131766a70e78bf130205c1c63acd5
(cherry picked from commit 661247a61708d9ceb716e0778ec0c83345ddd3ba)

For consistency with the tox jobs, use tox_envlist instead of
tox_venvlist.

We need first to add a new parameter, then change the job, then
remove the old parameter.

Change-Id: I3d4fa8a68d511d4b5555753bb1faa9bde8ee8c86

commit_message:
Rename tox_venvlist (2/2)

For consistency with the tox jobs, use tox_envlist instead of
tox_venvlist.

We need first to add a new parameter, then change the job, then
remove the old parameter.

Change-Id: I3d4fa8a68d511d4b5555753bb1faa9bde8ee8c86
Depends-On: I67a20b1faa77ff0166ad96fd95432c11948abc74

commit_message:
Remove pinned versions from test-requirements.txt

As we are using the upper constraints when running the release
notes task using tox, we do not need to set a specific version
and we can rely on whatever is configured in upper constraints.

Change-Id: I0fa09add42c9b87e3084297acbc42c7c0596d575
Co-Authored-By: Mohammed Naser <mnaser@vexxhost.com>

in puppet-vitrage [2]. Let's disable vitrage to

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530650

commit_message:
Disable vitrage in scenario001

Recent merge [1] in vitrage requires change
in puppet-vitrage [2]. Let's disable vitrage to
get the change in puppet-vitrage merged.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530650
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534215/

Change-Id: Iffaeb812199ff56a8bdfb987b9afd503013ea69d

This commit wires up the remaining bits to expose system role
assignments via the assignment API.

bp system-scope

commit_message:
Rename block_device_info_get_root

The other block_device_info_get_* methods return DriverBlockDevice
objects, but this method returns the root_device_name. We rename it in
preparation for a subsequent patch which adds a method returning a
DriverBlockDevice object for the root disk.

Change-Id: Ic2de01e62c5ed35c05f09ce2c74fd258f06a4109

Test that all object methods get shard container update headers

Extend existing test that POST requests get update headers for

Also some code cleanup for the includes parameter in the
get_shard_ranges path.

commit_message:
Add amulet test for pci-alias

Add an amulet test to check pci-alias setting is propagated
properly into nova.conf. This is a prerequisite for work to support
setting multiple aliases.

Change-Id: Ic8d51dfb3130670cd6810ca80378d6ef8c0d0346

subject: Don't add required attribute to html form fields
messages:
[{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-11-02 17:26:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12826, 'date': '2017-11-02 17:30:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This restores the behaviour to pre Django 1.10 I believe, which seems like a sensible decision.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2017-11-02 18:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I still want to have client-side validation, but this solution seems to be OK now'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2017-11-03 01:54:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Just a heads up before this is merged...

HTML5 form validation is setup to ignore fields that are hidden:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6944783/does-the-handling-of-hidden-form-controls-in-html5-make-sense

This likely means that the way we are hiding fields is odd, and rather than disabling a useful feature in HTML5 form validation, we should look at fixing how we are hiding form fields so that HTML5 does the expected thing.

I won't -1 this patch because this is a bug and fixing it first/quickly is more important than supporting HTML5, but we should follow this up with a proper fix."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-11-03 07:20:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I guess "hidden" isn't the right word in the technical sense. It seems to be using a "display: none" CSS style attribute, which isn't covered by that hidden type clause in the HTML5 spec.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-09 16:09:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-16 19:09:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/pike as commit 04491deed11022c29e24a02e69d750e981a7ac7a'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-02 17:26:22.000000000', 'message': 'Don't add required attribute to html form fields

In Django 1.10 a new Form property was introduced, defaulting to True,
which enabled HTML form validation for fields marked "required" in
Django. This changed old behavior, which was that required fields were
only validated server-side. This patch restores old behavior by setting
use_required_attribute to False for the inherited AuthenticationForm.

This problem arose because when WebSSO is enabled and a
non-keystone-credentials authentication method is selected from the
dropdown list, the now-hidden username and password fields are still
marked "required" and still validated client-side, even though they are
invisible to the user and cannot be filled in. It would be nice to fix
the javascript to properly turn the "required" attribute on or off
depending on what authentication method is selected and whether the
"required" fields are even visible, but for now this just restores the
behavior we had before Djanto 1.10.

Change-Id: I3e798a2288d9c33396b40a86b07ea8c163d3b525
Closes-bug: #1703109
'}]
commit_message:
Don't add required attribute to html form fields

In Django 1.10 a new Form property was introduced, defaulting to True,
which enabled HTML form validation for fields marked "required" in
Django. This changed old behavior, which was that required fields were
only validated server-side. This patch restores old behavior by setting
use_required_attribute to False for the inherited AuthenticationForm.

This problem arose because when WebSSO is enabled and a
non-keystone-credentials authentication method is selected from the
dropdown list, the now-hidden username and password fields are still
marked "required" and still validated client-side, even though they are
invisible to the user and cannot be filled in. It would be nice to fix
the javascript to properly turn the "required" attribute on or off
depending on what authentication method is selected and whether the
"required" fields are even visible, but for now this just restores the
behavior we had before Djanto 1.10.

Change-Id: I3e798a2288d9c33396b40a86b07ea8c163d3b525
Closes-bug: #1703109

commit_message:
use api attributes from neutron-lib

This patch moves the code over to neutron-lib's version of the
RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP in prep for neutron commit
Iaacee584d499c4d33d6d2dd9609c7ac0f2cfc386
It also removes the backup/restore of the global attribute map in the
UT code; it's not needed as a fixture is used in the parent classes
setup to patch the global map for you.

Change-Id: Ia5abccaaae53b2e40c652a02ce90f225a3ab231f

commit_message:
use EGRESS_DIRECTION and INGRESS_DIRECTION from neutron-lib

The EGRESS_DIRECTION and INGRESS_DIRECTION constants live in neutron-lib
now and neutron is going to consume them in
I1b81f5c3de9e6f2c0967c2db23ddb716ee7ec6b9

This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's version of the
constants.

Change-Id: I0be5ed40b6413155bcf87e209ce5332543e5bfae

commit_message:
Rename tox_venvlist (2/2)

For consistency with the tox jobs, use tox_envlist instead of
tox_venvlist.

We need first to add a new parameter, then change the job, then
remove the old parameter.

Depends-On: I67a20b1faa77ff0166ad96fd95432c11948abc74
Change-Id: I8cb03b9d03a2240386fb5a03bc40004f7f7e991c

commit_message:
Enable automatic restart of memcached, apache and mongodb

Prior to Newton, HA deployments had automatic restart of non-Openstack
services on controller nodes. From Newton onward, after we switched to
systemd for the vast majority of services, Openstack services are
configured for automatic restart, but memcached apache and mongodb
lack it.

Generate a drop-in file for the mentioned services, so they can
restart automatically in both HA and non-HA deployments.

Change-Id: I8576db193b358cf804e8aaeb0e05b31c635ae5ba
Closes-Bug: #1741263
(cherry picked from commit 54995d1d35616fa8354ddc0ff237d5912a703662)

commit_message:
Enable automatic restart of memcached, apache and mongodb

Prior to Newton, HA deployments had automatic restart of non-Openstack
services on controller nodes. From Newton onward, after we switched to
systemd for the vast majority of services, Openstack services are
configured for automatic restart, but memcached apache and mongodb
lack it.

Generate a drop-in file for the mentioned services, so they can
restart automatically in both HA and non-HA deployments.

Change-Id: I8576db193b358cf804e8aaeb0e05b31c635ae5ba
Closes-Bug: #1741263
(cherry picked from commit e84da28dc310f83ef6ac8ae61ccb4cc5fe6d3c2e)

messages:
[{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-11 06:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-11 06:53:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

We need https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/11282/ first'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-01-11 13:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Cross posting here my comment from https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/11282/1 

"""
Ok so just for the sake of completeness I quickly checked whether I can apply just the commit I need to fix the puppet-systemd bug for [1]:
  . puppet-systemd 1.0.0 (pike) has the bug and I can apply the fix
  . puppet-systemd 0.4.x (ocata and newton) don't even provide the feature so I can't even use the feature.

At this point, rather than rebasing puppet-systemd for all stable releases, I can also provide an alternative and equally simple patch that doesn't use puppet-systemd. I will need to do so for downstream because unfortunately RHOSP10 doesn't ship puppet-systemd, and this is the version that required the fix in the first place [2].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1741263
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1436495
"""

So it looks like the review as is won't work for pike ocata and newton unless be rebase puppet-systemd on all those release.

OTOH I can rework the review to use file resource and trigger "systemctl daemon reload". I will have to do it anyway for downstream unfortunately...

From a code standpoint this seems equally simple, and this is way less painful to backport.

What do you guys think about it?'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-16 18:08:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534394/'}]

commit_message:
Keystone: Move rally tests to values.yaml

This PS moves the rally tests to the values.yaml allowing
them to be driven by operators.

Change-Id: I3d65da011e39362db24c170a37cbffe71a63c20c

commit_message:
Change update/create method options

Rather than use booleans, switch to explicit definition of
which method is used. This is useful because 'update' can
when including Swift be 3 different methods, and that gets
messy with booleans. An explicit definition works nicer
and gives us more flexibility in future as well as a nicer
pattern for similar method remappings.

Depends-On: Icfa811571ec7c26617e0f8e9db086001fc0bc81f
Change-Id: I7e231a8c89ffd74fdd63aabafb408fadfdb69c67

[{'created': '2017-11-29 17:32:10.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce hpOneView and ilorest to OneView

It introduces the ``hpOneView`` and ``ilorest`` library to the
OneView Driver. This patch will be used as the standard patch to
other patches related to the removal of the ``python-oneviewclient``
library dependency.

Change-Id: Ib9d72ff5713d58631bcdccc817707b5d512e156e
Partial-Bug: #1693788
Co-Authored-By: Fellype Cavalcante <fellypefca@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Ricardo Araujo <ricardo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

commit_message:
Introduce hpOneView and ilorest to OneView

It introduces the ``hpOneView`` and ``ilorest`` library to the
OneView Driver. This patch will be used as the standard patch to
other patches related to the removal of the ``python-oneviewclient``
library dependency.

Change-Id: Ib9d72ff5713d58631bcdccc817707b5d512e156e
Partial-Bug: #1693788
Co-Authored-By: Fellype Cavalcante <fellypefca@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Ricardo Araujo <ricardo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

commit_message:
Rename the 'SAHARA_AUTO_IP_ALLOCATION_ENABLED' config parameter

The 'SAHARA_AUTO_IP_ALLOCATION_ENABLED' config parameter in Sahara
is confusing. If you wish to disable floating IP options during node
group template creation, set it 'True', but this name sounds like it
has to do with automatically associating a floating IP. So this patch
renames it to a meaningful variable name.

Change-Id: If8f71ea21cb71bbffe996f7db88b7683ad91ecac

commit_message:
logging: teach fluentd.pp about fluentd_service_user

This allows tripleo to explicitly set the user that will be used to
run the fluentd service, rather than relying on the package defaults.

Change-Id: I4e4bb72cc3f28d884c174fdf7df1594b344c1f40

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for trust APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I26bdb8cc3707b294c79b098211debf65f88587f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 02:24:55.000000000', 'message': "Expose a get_enforcer method for oslo.policy scripts

Because we have policy in code, we should be able to use the
oslo.policy CLI scripts to produce sample policy files and render
complete policies based on overrides on disk. This wasn't working
properly because keystone wasn't removed unexpected commandline
arguments before passing them to oslo.config to parse. This prevented
people from generating complete policy files like they would for
horizon.

This commit expose a get_enforcer() method similar to what nova has
done in keystone.common.policy that removes unexpected arguments
passed in from the system before shuffling those off to oslo.config
for a Config object.

Change-Id: I22583258eac5b3a64208355d18ccfa62dba1871d
Closes-Bug: 1740951

Because we have policy in code, we should be able to use the
oslo.policy CLI scripts to produce sample policy files and render
complete policies based on overrides on disk. This was broken
because keystone wasn't removing unexpected commandline arguments
before passing them to oslo.config to parse. This prevented
people from generating complete policy files like they would for
horizon.

This commit exposes a get_enforcer() that substitutes an empty list
in place of arguments passed in through the system. This makes it
so that oslo.config doesn't choke when processing configuration

Change-Id: I22583258eac5b3a64208355d18ccfa62dba1871d
Closes-Bug: 1740951

commit_message:
Expose a get_enforcer method for oslo.policy scripts

Because we have policy in code, we should be able to use the
oslo.policy CLI scripts to produce sample policy files and render
complete policies based on overrides on disk. This was broken
because keystone wasn't removing unexpected commandline arguments
before passing them to oslo.config to parse. This prevented
people from generating complete policy files like they would for
horizon.

This commit exposes a get_enforcer() that substitutes an empty list
in place of arguments passed in through the system. This makes it
so that oslo.config doesn't choke when processing configuration
values.

Change-Id: I22583258eac5b3a64208355d18ccfa62dba1871d
Closes-Bug: 1740951

commit_message:
Adjust gerrit ACLs for networking-generic-switch

Now that this project is under the bare metal program, change its ACLs
to be in line with official projects:
* revoke tagging rights (will be managed by openstack/releases)
* give ironic-core +2/+A on master

from the metadata of the original image when creating a snapshot of an

snapshot image and fail as this has changed from that of the original.

commit_message:
conf: Do not inherit image signature props with snapshots

All image signature properties should not be inherited from the metadata
of the original image when creating a snapshot of an instance. Otherwise
Glance will attempt to verify the signature of the snapshot image and
fail as this has changed from that of the original.

Closes-bug: #1737513
Change-Id: Ia3d80bf2f81c7317fec117aecbc3c560d51a7d4e

Restored PS17'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-01-10 20:02:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-01-11 17:57:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20: Code-Review+1

Thanks Martin, I tested ps20 and we're still missing something:

drwx------  5 root  root     4096 Jan 11 17:11 tripleo-v45fGC-config
-rw-rw-r--  1 stack stack    9330 Jan 11 17:42 tripleo-undercloud-passwords.yaml
-rw-------  1 root  root     1943 Jan 11 17:42 undercloud-passwords.conf

So tripleo-undercloud-passwords.yaml is 664 not 600 like undercloud-passwords.conf (and the ownership is different) - I guess it's not a deal breaker if the files end up owned by root due to the sudo, but I don't think we can have password files world readable...
[stack@undercloud ~]$ pwd
/home/stack"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-01-11 17:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

commit_message:
Generate undercloud-passwords.conf and fix output dir.

CI depends on undercloud-passwords.conf and its existance in its home
directory.  This generates the passwords file in the same format as
instack and also outputs all state to the same directory.

Co-Authored-By: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1c60fd2f2732acb343a2f128258dbf0141ba0c82

commit_message:
Use shell when deploying FreeIPA

Using command works but we get no logs of the deployment command
because the command module masks away the redirection operators.
https://blog.confirm.ch/ansible-modules-shell-vs-command/

Change-Id: Ib5fb3a76e0bd205791c6264cd3c2151618153108

commit_message:
Cleanup test-requirements

python-subunit is not used directly anywhere
and it is dependency of both testrepository
and os-testr
(probably was used by some tox wrapper script before)

Change-Id: I3c0ec9bda6cc07af0e6977608f80cff57c49ba95

[{'created': '2018-01-12 16:00:34.000000000', 'message': 'Rename tox_venvlist (2/2)

For consistency with the tox jobs, use tox_envlist instead of
tox_venvlist.

We need first to add a new parameter, then change the job, then
remove the old parameter.

Depends-On: I67a20b1faa77ff0166ad96fd95432c11948abc74
Change-Id: Iae93bf68976eee7c37cd4ae76764f1fb3d8d1dd5
'}]
commit_message:
Rename tox_venvlist (2/2)

For consistency with the tox jobs, use tox_envlist instead of
tox_venvlist.

We need first to add a new parameter, then change the job, then
remove the old parameter.

Depends-On: I67a20b1faa77ff0166ad96fd95432c11948abc74
Change-Id: Iae93bf68976eee7c37cd4ae76764f1fb3d8d1dd5

commit_message:
Ceph: add manifests optional for job-rbd-pool

Every manifests has to be controlled by manifests key in values.yaml.
In ceph, job-rbd-pool doesn't have manifests value,
so it can't be disabled.

When using already installed ceph, it is necessary to disable
job-rbd-pool because it is an unnecessary.

Change-Id: Idf61855423f28fbb1c7730118869bdddc463960b
Closes-bug: 1742017

[{'created': '2018-01-11 21:44:44.000000000', 'message': "Correct panko auth region

panko::auth::auth_region is hardcoded to use 'regionOne', making the
keystone region incorrect if someone alters it with a custom template.

This patch corrects this behaviour, utilizing KeystoneRegion.

Change-Id: I9c6b6e9ff098956bf640b88717da45fc1fd6a707
Closes-Bug: 1742201
Related-Bug: BZ1525729
(cherry picked from commit 5f3e82c41c2fb80e1314746bec5a6607e2ed3499)
"}]
commit_message:
Correct panko auth region

panko::auth::auth_region is hardcoded to use 'regionOne', making the
keystone region incorrect if someone alters it with a custom template.

This patch corrects this behaviour, utilizing KeystoneRegion.

Change-Id: I9c6b6e9ff098956bf640b88717da45fc1fd6a707
Closes-Bug: 1742201
Related-Bug: BZ1525729
(cherry picked from commit 5f3e82c41c2fb80e1314746bec5a6607e2ed3499)

commit_message:
Add validation task in docker services [cinder]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before stopping it.

commit_message:
OvsDpdkSocketMemory MTU Roundup in bytes

This change is to update OvsDpdkSocketMemory computation in DPDK
derive parameters for MTU Round off to the bytes and buffer value
is 512MB instead of 500MB.

Change-Id: Ib8970986b9ea66bb3c4b9b6824fbd733cba9c2bf
Closes-Bug: #1737709

their own unittests. Run them against keystoneauth

commit_message:
Add osc, shade and sdk tips jobs

python-openstackclient, shade and python-openstacksdk all have jobs that
test tips of important libraries (including keystoneauth) against
their own unittests. Run them against keystoneauth
so we can be sure we're not about to land a change that would
unwittingly break users.

Change-Id: Iac823dfdcafd6eee29b57c34c1e05dee0f191207
Depends-On: I599b18218c10cb08e508cca3b3bbc9c88b8f809c

commit_message:
Mark SAML loader properties as required

All the username and password fields for saml2 plugins are required.
Without them the plugin won't work.

Change-Id: I868b2b2a9f44913cb117eca554539d9bd356d621

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-11 13:32:54.000000000', 'message': 'Increase notification wait timeout in functional tests

In the baseline the wait_for_notification() functional test util
function by default waits maximum 1 second for a notification to
arrive. Based on recent gate failures it seems that it is not enough
in some cases for the notitification to arrive. Therefore this patch
bumps the default timeout to 10 seconds. This will only make the test
execution slower if the notifiication arrives later or does not even
arrive. So in the happy case the test execution will not be slower.

Change-Id: I75e2bcd87535de7e44bdf317c3ab12ba8952dcca
Closes-Bug: #1742688
'}]
commit_message:
Increase notification wait timeout in functional tests

In the baseline the wait_for_notification() functional test util
function by default waits maximum 1 second for a notification to
arrive. Based on recent gate failures it seems that it is not enough
in some cases for the notitification to arrive. Therefore this patch
bumps the default timeout to 10 seconds. This will only make the test
execution slower if the notifiication arrives later or does not even
arrive. So in the happy case the test execution will not be slower.

Change-Id: I75e2bcd87535de7e44bdf317c3ab12ba8952dcca
Closes-Bug: #1742688

commit_message:
Join nodes with traits

Join the node_traits table with the nodes table in some
DB operations.

Change-Id: Ic959b5c5b1d431edc55d9abe1c6c2d7b41d76fbd
Partial-Bug: #1722194

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 24863, 'date': '2017-12-21 03:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Unity: Attach Unity volume via IPv6.

The IPv6's ISCIS portal format is [IPv6Address]:Port.
The Unity returned IPv6 are not enclosed with brackets.
So Unity's cinder-driver has to add brackets for IPv6's ISCSI portal.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ib54fe948d0f5d7cad6c28468503f8535573ef3fc
Implements: blueprint unity-cinder-ipv6

commit_message:
[install] Use constraints in install script

The constrants file is a file with a list of tested versions of rally
dependencies.

We added this file in Rally 0.11.0~dev and need to use it everywhere to
ensure that everything works as expected.

Change-Id: Ifd5003a91f0a3e4f998b6f4f2ab01aa4a8626be6

commit_message:
Fix broken if in devstack/functions

There was a missing space in a conditional and therefore it was always
evaluating to false and throwing an error. Since the result of the
evaluation to false was the expected it was never discovered.

Change-Id: I406a390e55f0303d2207218fba5a86f7a5aa6eb8

Add show-odl-info role

This will print information about the interfaces, OVS, openstack and
ODL.

Change-Id: Icfa6969c9e0dbc5af8eee418fd2f8c427ebe5f9d

commit_message:
Remove ceilometer-api alarm type

This change removes the deprecated 'threshold' alarm type from Aodh.

This also removes the useless ceilometerclient dependency.

Depends-On: Id89130fd8a782dea863c85b37a919fbf0f0897dd
Change-Id: I7ccf930f2ad0316dbda0675a2ec0344e61986022

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-06 19:57:54.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add tracemalloc support

This commit adds an optional object to run tracemalloc in a thread to
periodically grab memory snapshots form a running service.

This is almost a verbatim copy from the example in the pytracemalloc
docs. [1]

[1] http://pytracemalloc.readthedocs.io/examples.html#thread-to-write-snapshots-into-files-every-minutes

Change-Id: Iac769ee15319f180dd92a00730e50e83dce48158
'}, {'created': '2017-02-06 20:11:39.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add tracemalloc support

This commit adds an optional object to run tracemalloc in a thread to
periodically grab memory snapshots form a running service.

This is almost a verbatim copy from the example in the pytracemalloc
docs. [1]

[1] http://pytracemalloc.readthedocs.io/examples.html#thread-to-write-snapshots-into-files-every-minutes

Depends-On: I859ad2f82ef901ff1b2082125b0496cb6babc8a0

commit_message:
WIP: Add tracemalloc support

This commit adds an optional object to run tracemalloc in a thread to
periodically grab memory snapshots form a running service.

This is almost a verbatim copy from the example in the pytracemalloc
docs. [1]

[1] http://pytracemalloc.readthedocs.io/examples.html#thread-to-write-snapshots-into-files-every-minutes

Depends-On: I9382711ef24d573eb5f9d89d50e815a344def742
Depends-On: I35ada7f77e0ac3ff474bfb649949d1f50431d01c
Depends-On: I859ad2f82ef901ff1b2082125b0496cb6babc8a0
Change-Id: Iac769ee15319f180dd92a00730e50e83dce48158

subject: DNM: Playing with pytracemalloc

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 05:52:03.000000000', 'message': 'Remove python-dev from list of preinstalled packages

python-dev package causes cloud-init to fail on Fedora-based
distros because the package is called python-devel there.
Since this package is present in python-pip recommended dependencies
and thus going to be installed anyway, there is no need to include
it explicitly. With this fix it becomes possible to use bare
Fedora cloud image with murano

Change-Id: Iebc084bdbf6827b93b700ae1a29b1f76fb3161eb
'}, {'created': '2018-01-16 16:11:16.000000000', 'message': 'Remove python-dev from list of preinstalled packages

python-dev package causes cloud-init to fail on Fedora-based
distros because the package is called python-devel there.
Since this package is present in python-pip recommended dependencies
and thus going to be installed anyway, there is no need to include
it explicitly. With this fix it becomes possible to use bare
Fedora cloud image with murano

Change-Id: Iebc084bdbf6827b93b700ae1a29b1f76fb3161eb
'}]
commit_message:
Remove python-dev from list of preinstalled packages

python-dev package causes cloud-init to fail on Fedora-based
distros because the package is called python-devel there.
Since this package is present in python-pip recommended dependencies
and thus going to be installed anyway, there is no need to include
it explicitly. With this fix it becomes possible to use bare
Fedora cloud image with murano

Change-Id: Iebc084bdbf6827b93b700ae1a29b1f76fb3161eb

commit_message:
Add default timeout for tests triggered by tox

There is currently no timeout and tests disable the timeout for that
reason. It seems the timeout variable was lost in a migration. This
patch adds a default timeout of 60 again.

Change-Id: I24e13e3e1e48e0509c9afbf43ac39060fb74af91

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-07 18:35:55.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] [Concept] Add NetName to Port: resource in role tamplate

[NOTE]
This is something I did for experimentation only.
- I don't think using multiple networks like this is the
  best idea.
- Also not sure if we want to use custom roles for each
  leaf like this does.

But want to share to foster collective thinking on tripleo
routed networks.

Templates used with this patch here:
https://github.com/hjensas/tripleo-roles-spine-leaf

Change-Id: I0c64be89eb354aafede8f553a740d3e7fe8ab3f8
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] [Concept] Add NetName to Port: resource in role tamplate

[NOTE]
This is something I did for experimentation only.
- I don't think using multiple networks like this is the
  best idea.
- Also not sure if we want to use custom roles for each
  leaf like this does.

But want to share to foster collective thinking on tripleo
routed networks.

Templates used with this patch here:
https://github.com/hjensas/tripleo-roles-spine-leaf

Change-Id: I0c64be89eb354aafede8f553a740d3e7fe8ab3f8
